The location is superb, easy access to the north for the attractions along the beachs, Sea World, etc. and around the harbor to downtown sites, neighborhoods and dining. The airport is close at hand but the flight patterns are such that you rarely hear the take-off noise. The concert venue is great, buy the packages if you want to see a show. An oasis that is just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Type Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhonaP
Reviews.Content: Based on trip advisor comments, this was 1 of 3 hotels we stayed in during our recent visit to San Diego and I knew it would be the best of the 3. I was looking for a resort type hotel for the end of our trip and this was it and it exceeded our expectations. 1. I normally would have booked the least expensive room but it was not avail. but now I’m glad I spent a little more because we had a renovated room ( # 129) with a patio steps away from the pool. Arriving at 10:30 AM there was a room ready but I wanted one close to the pool and the 1st floor so we came back later. We booked the hotel on their website and it was less expensive to get the zoo package ($111. night and 2 zoo tkts) then to get the room without the tickets. Room # 129 was steps away from the pool. It was recently renovated and gorgeous – spacious, wood beamed ceiling, modern bathroom with designer bowl sink, safe, nice size refrig and m/w with lots of shelves to keep our breakfast food which we got at nearby VONS supermarket. Can’t forget to mention the big flat screen TV (42” maybe). Very comfy pillowtop mattress beds. This room had sliding doors leading to a patio. Some second floor rooms have a balcony. I believe the lower priced rooms do not have the patio or balcony. 2. Pool is big especially compared to the 2 other hotels we stayed in and others we saw in San Diego. There is also a pool bar, towels provided at the pool, a nice size ‘hot’ hot tub and ping pong table. 3. They have decent bicycles and you get 2 hrs complementary per day. My family took advantage of this and used them for 3 days bicycling around the marinas and even biking to nearby Harbor Island. Although the chains did fall off 2 of the bicycles. 4. On part of the property is Humphrey’s Outdoor theatre – a small theatre with big name entertainment.. We lucked out as the 1st night we checked in “Three Dog Night” played. You are not able to see the stage as the rooms are located behind it (except for a few rooms that do overlook the stage) but we certainly could hear the music. Check out their concert schedule (Diana Ross, Sheryl Crow, Jackson Browne, etc – I was told some of them sell out in 10 minutes) 5. There is another area where there is live music other nights (Billy Joel tribute band while we were there) and I found out at check-out hotel guests are allowed to go for free – although I read the welcome e-mail after we got home and it did say this.. 6. The hotel grounds are beautiful and smaller than I expected – check out the fish ponds, marina, and putting green. 7. There is a restaurant with room service but we didn’t try it. We went to nearby Joao’s A Tin Fish Bar and Eatery in Pt. Loma using restaurant.com $25 off and I had one of the best fish meals I have ever eaten. Also the BK’s brewery chain offers a not publicized great 2 for $20 special – 1 med. Speciality pizza, soup and salad, and dessert. There are many restaurants nearby including fast food ones. 8. Two computers with a printer located in the lobby – nice gesture as we used it to print our boarding passes. Also free wi-fi in the rooms. 9. When we were checking in, one person requested later check-out and she was given 12:30 the latest (12:00 is regular check-out). The day we were to leave I asked for later check-out and we were given 1:00pm. 10. Parking is an extra $10 per night and you use your room key to put up the gate. During concert nights, there is a guard at the gate to make sure only hotel guests use the lot. 11. There is fitness center but it is small, about 4 pieces of equipment. There is nothing negative about this hotel, except I did ask twice for the outside patio light to be fixed which is wasn’t but that really is inconsequential. For more money I was considering the Hilton or Sheraton but I am so glad I didn’t. Perfect room, friendly staff, scenic, steps away from the pool and our car, complementary bikes, surrounded by beautiful landscaping and marinas all around – Humphreys is the greatest !! Can’t wait to return !!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Virgin for this recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: EMA2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Virgin, and we were very pleased upon arrival! The hotel is in a lovely location, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely, clean, well maintained and overlooked the marina and stage (fortunately no shows!!) Only a short walk to the pool, which was very refreshing! The breakfast in the restaurant was very good, and the staff always pleasant. We liked this hotel so much we booked an extra night!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal! I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kjjclay
Reviews.Content: I just stayed this last weekend and I will continue to come back again and again! The rooms were clean, well decorated, and very cozy. The staff was very accomodating and extremly friendly. The food is amazing and very reasonable for a resort. Whether you are taking a vacation, staycation, or business.. Humphrey's Half Moon Inn is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Almost like a stay in Hawaii.”
Reviews.Author: dorightValleVista_CA
Reviews.Content: Everything at this destination is TOPS. Every morning as I take my walk along the Harbor walk (across the street) I thank the Lord for my being here. Have been coming to Humphrey's with famly and friends for over 12 years for 3 to 5 days at a time and 3 to 6 times a year. Have stayed at the Marriott, Sheraton, and Hilton in S.D. They are all very nice, but Humphrey's beats them all. Their staff is like being with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SLHbigfoot
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel. Stayed three nights, room w/partial view of water facing parking lot. Hotel has open air concerts weekly, which can be noisy (7:30-10:30pm) but fun if you like the performers as even w/o paying, you can hear most of the concert all over the hotel. Nice pool area and good food in restaurant/lounge. Parking can be tight, but is gated. Staff helpful/polite. Frig and microwave handy, but didn't really care for bathroom setup. Has air conditioning and ceiling fan. The electricity went off our last day/night, and the hotel was very accommodating about refunding full price for that day for inconvenience caused to patrons (room got HOT). Beach across the street with very nice walking along a sidewalk above it. Felt like a very safe area, even walking after dark. Had breakfast at the "local" restaurant (about 3 block walk) "Point Break". Seemed a bit dark and older, but food was very good and plenty of it. Avoid the bathroom if you don't like "nostalgic" toilets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, worth the extra cost.”
Reviews.Author: Choppers70
Reviews.Content: I scrambled last minute to find a new hotel after a reading a miserable review about the one I had booked (next door). Humphreys was slightly more expensive and didn't have the included breakfast, (which would have been a big money saver in San Diego), but I'm so glad I made the change. Booked the "Premier" guest room and was upgraded to a tropical room but pretty sure all that meant was internal patio access rather than facing the parking lot. The parking lot rooms have a nice wall built up around the patio so it wouldn't have been bad at all. Room looked just like the website images. Beds were comfortable, room appeared to be clean. There is a slight damp smell if the AC gets turned down but that's to be expected in any area surrounded by water. I'm very sensitve to musty smells and I was FINE there. Pool was great, room service was great, grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. So convenient to everything in San Diego. Will absolutely stay there again. If you don't want to be kept up at night, request a room that is not overlooking the concert stage. If you like live music, definitely request one that does overlook the stage! (great deal as tickets are $80 +)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Big Suite, and Tropical Landscaping...”
Reviews.Author: SeeksTranquility
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this summer with a large group in the marina view suite.(1000 square feet) It was a wonderfully large group of rooms, and our view of the marina and surrounding hills was lovely. The kitchen was fully equipped and recently redone, and the bathroom was great, too. The dining room was large and included a spacious round table where one could fit 8-10 people. We arrived for check-in and were told that we couldn't be processed due to a computer problem. Our family group ranged in age from an infant to an elderly person and we had to wait for over an hour to check in to our room, but we were comfortable sitting in the lobby. Lots of other people were in our same predicament, and the desk clerks handled all the impatient people very well. One guy had a little temper tantrum and even threw an object, but the clerk ignored it and that non-reaction rather diffused the situation. Another guest simply picked up the launched object ( a paper cup), and deposited it in a trash bin. Our inconvenience was compensated by free parking for two days ($40.00 saved...2 cars) and also we had $50.00 knocked off the bill for the room so we were satisfied. We rated the place four stars instead of five due to the discomfort of the sofa beds and beds in the bedroom, but that's just taste. One of our party members loved the bed. A trip to Humphreys will happen again--to us it's a hidden little gem, and next time we will enjoy a concert there!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Deal but Some Cons”
Reviews.Author: batman8072
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Humphreys for years and in the beginning it was hit or miss. I noticed a number of guests had some really negative things to say about the rooms and so I wanted to add my review to help provide some insight. Since Humphreys began renovating the rooms a few years back, I've now learned to always book the renovated room vice the suites which are a bit outdated. They have been completely redone and are both roomy and really comfortable. It's nice to come back to your room after a long day and just plop down on a big comfy bed or sit on your patio enjoying the bay breeze. The pool is nice and always clean and you cannot beat the room price & view. Especially in the off season. The renovated rooms have a large, flat screen tv, microwave, refrigerator and free high speed internet. They also have a mailing list where you'll receive great room package deals. The customer service varies. Housekeeping and room service staff are among some of the nicest people I've encountered when traveling. (The room service menu is excellent by the way and the french toast is to die for.) The front desk can be a challenge. They frequently seem to be short handed or have someone a little inept working during the prime check in/out times and if the computer in the business center isn't working, there doesn't seem to be anyone on-site to help. If you can get one of the renovated rooms, I would highly recommend chosing Humphreys for your next trip to San Diego. It's in a quite location on Shelter Island but only a short drive to everything San Diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodations while I did the conference thing.”
Reviews.Author: GSM33530
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for a conference in mid July and all things considered, had a wonderful stay. The rooms were definitely renovated since our stay in 2007, when the pink and gold interior was a bit outdated. If I were to go back and had to deal with small children (as we did) I would look for a lower level room close to the pool or putting green. Many of the upstairs rooms do not have a balcony, and having a place for the bambinos to run around right outside the door is one of the great treats of this place. In fact, the outdoors are why I would go back- the rooms themselves are acceptable, but not necessarily special. The grounds, as many others have stated, are perfect, and the pool is far above average, especially considering the price. We could have gone to the Grand Hyatt or W hotel downtown, and with kids, I would choose Humphreys every time.

Reviews.Title: “This place was one of the best places I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: Triplel129
Reviews.Content: The staff and junior suite not to mention the Concerts by the Bay were fabulous. The staff could not have been more accomodating to my son and I and the friends we traveled with. It is located central to everything and easy to get to Sea World, Seaport Village and the beaches. Our first stay but will go back again next time we are in San Diego. Hats off to the staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: theprincesspeggy
Reviews.Content: I love this place. . The staff are very friendly/helpful and the rooms are very nice. The price is very reasonable. Great place for a getaway. I try to go there at least once a year especially for the concerts. I would recommend this place to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise in paradise”
Reviews.Author: CHIM-CHIM702
Reviews.Content: Humphrey's by the bay, is a classic example of why San Diego is the world's number one vacation spot. From the moment, I arrived, I was treated like a King. Smiling faces, greet you, the place couldn't be more breathtaking. I had a question about connecting to the internet, this young lady went out of her way to ensure I was comfortable with the system. The rooms were clean, the beds were bliss. If you are lucky enough to visit America's finest city; I can highly recommend staying at Humphrey's. It's a little piece of paradise in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: konakini
Reviews.Content: Huge room, clean, comfy with wonderful views of the harbor. The grounds were beautiful, you felt you were in a lush tropical garden. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I always keep up with the entertainment they have, a wide variety of venues - could go back a dozen times if I had the time.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Romantic Getaway with Complimentary Champagne!!!”
Reviews.Author: BMW550_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Humphries Half Moon Inn when I was a small child a long time ago and wanted to return back there for my 15th wedding anniversary as I remembered it as a remarkable magical place. I was not disappointed at all. I was amazed it was much more beautiful and tropical than I had remembered. We both had a fantastic time there. We stayed in a large suite with a full size kitchen overlooking the marina and it was absolutely paradise. The staff was extra friendly and very helpful and our room and the grounds were always meticulously clean. They have a five star restaurant on site and the food is fabulous. We will most definitely be going back there again and again, and would highly recommend the Half Moon Inn to anyone that enjoys a wonderful slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, and great service.”
Reviews.Author: MsBobbi88
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions. The rooms facing the water have great views, and they have great room service. The restaurant also has great food, and pool area is great! Overall, I love staying here, it's a great hotel in San Diego and is also close to downtown and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else, well . . .”
Reviews.Author: NVTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of June, and I picked this placed based on the glowing reviews. Not a very good call on my part. Our stay did not start off very well. We showed up promptly at 4pm, which their policy states is their check-in time. However there was only one person manning the desk. With only 2 customers in front of us, I didn't think we would have long to wait. 20 minutes later, we finally get to check-in. By that time, there were an additional 6 people behind us - that is NOT an exaggeration! I booked through the hotel's website months ago for a waterview deluxe junior suite. Checking in, the staff starts off "oh we have some great upgrages for you, we're giving you this larger garden view and pool view suite" WT . . .! I booked a waterview room so I could see OCEAN, not pool water! I told her thanks, but no thank you, I booked a waterview suite, and that's what I wanted. We did get the waterview room that we asked for, but beware of the location of your room. Ours was closest to the end, nearest to the restaurant, in building A. Which also happens to be an entrance/exit for their concert venue. Which also happens to be the location of the port-o-potties. Folks, there's has to got be a better place for those! Thanks goodness it never really got hot while we were there, because they leave the doors to the building open - I can't imagine what the hallways would smell like on nice warm day! The hotel room was ok - I will be posting some pictures of some things in the room that were somewhat questionable. I thought the walls were too thin - hallway noise, but that's pretty typical in most hotels, but you could hear when our "neighbor" was moving things around, we think, in their closet. The patio was really too small to sit out on all the time or even comfortably (it was one of their diagonal ones), plus the chairs looked really too filthy to sit on - I used towels to cover them just so we wouldn't feel the ick factor. We did enjoy the view immensely, and is the only reason we're giving three stars instead of the one star that I wanted to give. We stayed on the San Diego bay side (verses the marina side), which we did not regret. If you're a big boating/navy enthusiast, you will get to see a lot of traffic going in and out of the harbor. Not to mention all the planes (if you don't mind the occasional jet take-off noise), that we got to see take off from the naval base on Coronado. Please keep in mind, if you stay on the SD bay side your first view will be of the parking lot, then of the road, then of the water. It's not very private, and if you have a too small balcony, not very relaxing, but it was fun watching the show. If we ever go to San Diego again, we liked staying on Shelter Island, but I think we'll be looking for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, accommodating, relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: clsee1515
Reviews.Content: Great vacation! Humphreys was very accommodating from the time we landed to the time we left. The shuttle arrived at the airport before we even got to the pickup area, then made a turn around to pick us up on our departure day. Upon our early arrival, they found an available room and also made sure that 2 other families were located in the same building. Our extended family and friends (I think we had 8-9 rooms) experienced a wonderful reunion weekend along with the greatest brunch ever! Our room (#256) was very comfortable, roomy, clean and quiet. We enjoyed a nice jacuzzi evening with other guests and drinks from the pool bar, how convenient! The Island Hopper shuttle service picks up right in front of the hotel. We used them twice to connect to the Old Town Trolly Tours. At the end of our second day, after having had one of their busses break down, they used an extra bus to take just us back to Humpherys! The happy hour at the restaurant was perfect after a long day of sightseeing. Great food & prices! There was even a live band. A walk across the street to San Diego bay was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Excellent Hotel Service, Lovely Views”
Reviews.Author: Boo1000
Reviews.Content: Humphreys Half Moon is really interesting. The grounds are simply beautiful, with trpoical plants, plams, ponds and carp. At night the lighting in the grounds is quite magical and the marina backdrop is stunning. Our room entrance felt a bit like a motel, as you entered a separate block from the car park area (at first I felt a bit nervous that anyone from the street could know the door at night!). The room was very big, with a great little kitchenette and a really cosy lounge with patio doors that opened onto a ground floor balcony over looking the stage (yes the hotel has a small but cool music venue attached!) We also had a perfect view of the marina - great to watch the sunset. The room was really clean, well presented. It was a little dated (but really that is just taste I think). The managers had seen that it was my husands birthday during our USA trip and had left a goody basket and birthday card - brilliant! The swimming pool was gorgeous. We hate in the attached restuarant on the first night - the staff were a bit dopey. It was the only bad service we had the whole time we were in the US, it was a real contrast to the hotel staff who were great. The location is tricky. It was great for views and only took 15 -20 mins to get to the Zoo and Sea World. It is directly across the water from downtown; this means as the sun goes down and lights come up you have great views of Downtown San Diego and the Naval base....but it isn't close to go into town at night and you would need to drive in. All in I would reccommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Stay Fantastic newly renovated rooms, we still love Humphreys”
Reviews.Author: stuart c
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Humphreys and i have to say that this still is our favorite hotel. upon check in we were given room 333, we had this room the first time we stayed at Humphreys and what a difference, the room looked fantastic, it had just been renovated and we were the first to use it, New Carpets, Beds Huge flat screen TV, New Fridge and Microwave the bathroom had 2 new sinks built into an oak counter. The grounds and gardens as usual were amazing as was the swiming pool area, the hot tub on 2 of our 7 day stay was only luke warm but the hotel staff when told quickly came and sorted it out. as our holiday this time was spread over the 3 week we used the hotels laundry, both the washing machine and tumble driers worked very well and didnt cost much at all. we didnt eat at Humphreys resturant this time due to the amount of different choices in the area. Thanks Humphreys

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but walls are paper thin.”
Reviews.Author: BigGameProShop
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, and loved the location on Shelter Island. The pool and spa were very nice and the ducks were fun to watch. We payed extra for a renovated room (I think called premium room) and I am glad we did. The room is what I would have expected for a hotel room, so something that wasn't as nice and new - I probably would not have been happy. My only complaint was the noise. Saturday night we heard the ice machine being used ALL night long, until about 4 or 5 am. The ice machine was only a problem that Sat. night, but every night and morning we could hear everyone outside, and the people next to us. We loved the location and would probably still stay again, but the noise was kind of annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: nutplus
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed for 3 nights and were upgraded when I checked in early. Kristina at the front desk was "very" professional and attentive to us while at the desk, and each time we had a question. She focused her attention on "us" and did not get distracted when phones rang or other guests tried to interrupt. The head groundskeeper we spoke with, Victor, was helpful in giving directions and answered our questions about the landscaping. It was apparent that he took pride in the work that he did, as well as his staff. Our room was clean and was scenic because it overlooked the stage and marina. My brother stayed at Humphrey's a couple of days after we had and he and his wife had an incredible 25th anniversary, thanks again to Kristina and all the staff. We all will look forward to staying there in the future. Great job Humphrey's!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like MOLD, MILDEW & FILTH”
Reviews.Author: kaskade
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week in a Grand Marina Suite. We got physically sick from a kitchen floor that was soaking wet underneath which became very musty smelling and gross. They finally moved us to another unit after 3 days. They still rented the gross unit the same day we moved out. The management of this resort does NOT care about fixing anything! We will never go back. The kitchen was not furnished with enough plates, utensils... The pool and grounds are beautiful but not worth staying here due to the rooms. They also say they have remodeled but it's not true, the rooms are dark, dank and dusty.

Reviews.Title: “It is like being in the tropics!”
Reviews.Author: belknagr
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Diego and staying at Humphrey's made it most enjoyable. My mom had stayed at Humphrey's with her sisters back in October and had a wonderful stay. When my mom and I decided to take my 7 year old son to Lego Land she suggested we stay there. The grounds are beautiful and so well kept. My son was thrilled with the pool, hot tub, ping pong table and real putting green. We borrowed putters and golf balls from the front desk and he thought he was really playing golf. The staff was great. We ordered room service twice and it was delivered quickly and was adequate. The restaurants at the hotel are a bit expensive especially if you are traveling with kids. We rented a car and found several suitable places close to the hotel to eat. We were also pleased with the fact that the room had a microwave and refrigerator so we could buy cereal and milk as well as re-heat left overs for my son. The room was adequate and clean. My mom and I enjoyed sitting on our little patio and having a drink in the evening while enjoying the beautiful tropical trees, flowers and plants. The hotel has a free shuttle to the airport that we should have taken advantage of. We picked up our rental car at the airport which was a nightmare (long lines, hot, tired child). In the future I would have the car delivered to the hotel as my mom did on her previous trip. The hotel staff was very helpful with sightseeing advice and planning. All in all, San Diego is a beautiful city and we had a wonderful stay at Humphreys!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyCoastAussies
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were amazed at how lovely the place looked, especially for the price we paid. There was a bit of a mix-up at check in and we ended up being checked in to a room with people still in it. But the staff were very apologetic and gave us a new room. The rooms were spacious and clean, and dark in the morning (its rare to find a motel with black out curtains that work!!) The only problem is that it is $10 a night for parking, but if you are aware of it before hand then there is no problem. Would definately stay here again... and again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds/ Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sluna
Reviews.Content: We reserved a Deluxe Junior Suite which was very roomy and had a view of the marina. Across the street from the hotel is a great park for walking or jogging with a view of the San Diego Skyline. There are great restaurants within walking distance--Pomodoro was a great Italian restaurant. There was also a great happy hour at Humphrey's with Great prices.

Reviews.Title: “I was in heaven and I hope to go there again!”
Reviews.Author: Red4455
Reviews.Content: I lived in San Diego for 10 years and always wanted to stay at Humphreys Half Moon Inn. As an East Coaster now, I finally did in March 2010. By far, it was one of most enjoyable experiences I have ever had. Our upgraded suite was beautiful and spacious and luxurious. The flora and fauna made me feel as if I had arrived in paradise. I hope to return very, very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: VacationLoverSB10
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying here but once we arrived, we knew it was the right place for us. The landscaping is beautiful and makes you feel like you are in a tropical garden, very Hawaiian. The pool and hot tub area are clean and beautiful. Upon our early check-in we were given a room that had not been renovated yet. I have to admit that we were very disappointed in this room and called the front desk to ask for another room. Although they were unable to change our room that night, they did change it the next day for the rest of our stay. The lower level king bed room that we stayed in had a nice patio complete with patio chairs and a table that faced the interior garden area (pool). There are some rooms that face the marina and some that face the harbor. Our first room faced the harbor and San Diego skyline, however, the parking lot and road are also there which I felt were noisy, not as peaceful as the garden rooms. There are no elevators so if you have an upper room, there will be stairs to climb. It appeared that upper level rooms had shared balconies with the room next door. This would be easily verified with the hotel front desk. The beds were pretty comfortable and the rooms with king beds were very roomy. We plan on returning to this hotel the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - will return”
Reviews.Author: DavidRTX
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. I travel all over the world and it was great to find a place that has a great combination of rooms, affordability, and location. You can literally walk to any one of a number of restaurants and convenience stores. I will absolutely return to this location when I go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: Jamison
Reviews.Content: Last stop on a frantic 5 day tour of southern California. So lovely, wished I had booked 2 nights. I had spent my first night in the Gas Lamp, so was in no need of night life. Everything was perfect from the reception, to the grounds ( lovely -very Hawaiian, gorgeous plantings and seating areas). The room was over sized and redecorated - flat screen TV, microwave, fridge and sweet little dressing area/ with table and mirror - double sinks in bathroom with good qualtiy bath products in abundance - nice fluffy towels....the pool was heated and great for lap swimming, the hot tub was divine - perfect temp and jets.... Took advantage of the 'happy hour' special at the restaurant. Treated to a GREAT band, 1/2 price drinks and fabulous appetizers ( the scallop/shrimp salad FAR exceeded my expectations- beuatiful vista of sunset over the bay with SO may yachts....Great comfy, spot to slow down and appreciate the views with a caring staff - I highly recommend this hotel over any chain hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: goblue445
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to San Diego for our son's graduation from Marine Corp Boot Camp. We decided to stay at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn. Our experience at this hotel for the week was unforgetable. The facility and grounds were immaculate. Lots of trees and flowers all over the property and very clean. Our room looked out onto the marina which was breath taking. Happy Hour in the bar was excellent. They have a great selection of beer/wine. The shrimp and black bean quesadilla were out of this world!!! The holel restaurant had a very diverse selection of wonderful entrees. The restaurant was very clean and had a very impressive view. The service was also excellent. After eating be sure to check out the bar....they have live music every night of the week. The bar itself if very cozy and has excellent acoustics. The hotel also has an AMAZING pavilion where they have concerts, unfortunately we were there out of season for concerts. I will ABSOLUTELY be returning to this hotel. They hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel like royalty, they even provided free transportation to the base both days of the graduation. The vehicles were new and very clean. Please do yourself a favor and stay here the next time you are in San Diego. It is only minutes from the airport as well..You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: carrotop
Reviews.Content: Beautiful surroundings, view of downtown San Diego, and nice rooms. We stayed in a "regular" room which was above average size with small refrigerator, safe, and coffee maker. It was pool side and had small patio on first floor. Rooms on 2nd floor do not have a balcony. Rooms on first floor facing the parking lot have a privacy fence and no view. Excellent large out door pool, tropical theme. They are in the process of remodeling all the rooms with new flat screen TV, wood blinds, etc - looks nice from the outside. We especially enjoyed the lounge - 1/2 price drinks and appitizers, beautiful view of the docking facility with sailboats and entertainment in the evening. It was a "happening" place.

Reviews.Title: “Forget downtown, a San Diego gem”
Reviews.Author: banshee17
Reviews.Content: If you want to avoid the freeway noise of hotel circle and aren't looking to enter the downtown nightlife fray then this is one of the better places to stay in San Diego. Shlter Island is a lovely little strip of land between between the marina and bay that is quiet and incredibly beautiful. There's a nice path to walk/jog on along both the marina and bay side. My husband and I have always loved staying on Shelter Island when we're in town, and while we prefer to stay at the Kona Kai down on the end as it's quieter we have always liked Humphrey's. If you can, get a marina view. They are the quietest of the rooms. The bay view room face the street. The courtyard is quite lovely. The restaurant is quite good if you don't want to venture into town or down the street on Scott to Point Loma Seafood, and despite the truly uncomfortable chairs the outdoor concerts are great. The rooms have been remodeled quite recently and are clean and serene now versus the older French traditional meets 50's tiki confusion. For last minute reservations, assuming you can get a room, they have great deals. The beds are relatively comfortable (though the pillows are on the lumpy side) and the tv's are large flat screens. We had room service for breakfast and my omelette was better than most room service concoctions.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME & MONEY HERE !”
Reviews.Author: Ron079
Reviews.Content: 1. Initially given room 125 but it had a horrible odor so relocated to room 123 2. Rooms are extremely small for a so called 4 star hotel 3. No microwave in room 4. Continued running of the commode all day and night 5. Exercise room small with little equipment for use 6. Parking is $10.00 per day This was simply not a 4 star hotel. It is more like a 2 star. The landscape is nice so if you are only concerned about the outside of the hotel then it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman58
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here before and after a cruise. Lovely location, our accommodation was spotless, and the staff were extremely helpful even arranging our check-in at the Airport prior to our flight home to the UK. We certainly hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “1 amazing weekend”
Reviews.Author: KeithP7
Reviews.Content: Oddly enough I stayed there with somebody very special and it was the perfect place to be. I'm from San Diego and have been to several great concerts at Humphry's and stayed one other time but that's another story ;)...Great place to stay and see San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “If you love ants crawling over your things, this place is for you..”
Reviews.Author: harlanhu28
Reviews.Content: We booked a Marina view room with 2 queen beds for two adults and one baby.. First room was located right next to the exhaust fan for the restaurant with a severely obstructed view.. Second room had a view of the bay but was infested with ants very tiny ants.. These ants were very very small and were not noticeable till the morning light.. Was disappointed by the reaction of the staff..

Reviews.Title: “HATED TO LEAVE!”
Reviews.Author: welcometraveler
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Half Moon Inn after 40 years and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay...so much so that we extended our stay. The staff was very accomodating and the gardens are beautiful! When you reserve, you have the option to order delightful treats to be delivered to your room each day...we chose something different each day and enjoyed coming back after a day of sightseeing to find homemade cookies and milk, a fruit platter and special cashew brittle waiting for us there. Our server in the dining room, Tito, made us feel right at home, as did the other staff with whom we came in contact. We really hated to leave, but all good things must end...until next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, you will be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tommygx1
Reviews.Content: Noise, unprofessional empoyees, poor management, this place has it all. The rooms are OK looking, but the walls must be made of rice paper. You can hear everything, including the planes taking off and landing at SD Airport. The people above us came home about 2 in the morning, stomped around and then the tub/shower ran for the longest time. Soon we heard water dripping in OUR bathroom and noticed it was coming thru the ceiling light fixtures. Long story short, we moved to another unit at 230 AM, led thru the dark by the security guard, who said the same thing happened last week to another couple.Surprise! At checkout the next morning, I waited for the manager prior to checkout, who was busy with 2 other partys, explaining their dilema with noisy guests and the hot room, as mentioned in another review. We explained our story, and she noted all the notes were there from the night before. She gave us $25 off the room, which I will use to stay in any other hotel but that one ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful environment with a very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MichiganARae
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference in San Diego, and I accompanied him. We thoroughly enjoyed this resort the four nights we were there, from the room to the great service to the total environment. Any questions we had were answered with a smile and lots of helpful information; a couple of extra amenities were supplied when requested; and the lush tropical gardens right outside our patio were truly relaxing and enjoyable. The free internet service even worked on the patio, too, so I could be online while listening to the birds, waterfall in the pond, and wind in the flowers and trees around the pool. The staff was the best, though (mainly Donna, the very knowledgeable and pleasant Concierge). We had a rental car (through a discount at the resort), and the resort is close to everything. We will definitely stay at Humphrey's again on our next trip to San Diego! Thank you very much. Bob and Diane

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: MaryKateStarKiss
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. The rooms are uniquely designed-very cool. Our suite was like a private getaway...like a little bungalow or condo. Did not feel like we were staying in a hotel at all. <3 <3 <3 it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaAnne
Reviews.Content: My husband, our daughter and I stayed in one of the Marina Suites at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn & Suites over Thanksgiving weekend. The suite was fantastic. It was very roomy, the kitchen was fully stocked. The view out of the numerous windows and from the balcony was beautiful. The location on Shelter Island is perfect for walks along the bay. There is plenty to do and staying in is just as lovely. We really appreciated this place and will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: cda2010
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel was great with views overlooking the harbour. Jogged every morning along the shoreline. Felt like we were located in a quiet seaside town but we were centrally located to everything. The hotel is not overly ostentatious but warm and friendly. The staff was great, going out of their way to make our stay special. The chief concierge, Donna, was knowledgeable, well organized and friendly. Donna had a list of attractions to the area with specific, easy to read directions on how to get to each place - very helpful. This was a great value located in the heart of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it so much in the summer we went back for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Twoplus2kids
Reviews.Content: Great rooms if you get a marina view - as we did. Not so sure I'd enjoy a room looking onto the car park? Junior suite was well worth the extra. Lots of room, somewhere to cook if you feel like it.. I'd stay there agian. Loved San Diego - my new fav place in the USA

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: 10Sgal55
Reviews.Content: Beware of booking a suite at this hotel. Apparently, the regular/standard size rooms have been renovated, but the suites have not. Our suite was on the 2nd floor, a garden view, equipped with 2 queen size beds, and a sofa sleeper. It also had a spacious kitchen, so size-wise, it was a great value (we got a great rate on the San Diego Chamber of Commerce website), but there were drawbacks to this suite. It is very dark; the lighting is dim, and the drapes, comforters, and carpets are dark and heavy. The closet doors kept coming off it's tracks, and the beds are worn and old (my back was killing me by the 3rd day!). No free wi-fi as advertised. Walls are VERY thin, we could hear complete conversations from the suite right next to us. The room was also musty, really kicked up my allergies. $10.00 daily parking fee, and one of the nights the lot was full, so we had to park outside of the hotel lot. The hotel staff are a bit on the surly side, not particularly helpful nor friendly. The workout room is small, some of the machines have been tampered with, which is surprising because the equipment appears to be new. Also, this hotel is located at Shelter Island, which is a distance to any sight-seeing and attractions. The big plus is the size of the suite, which can easily accomodate a family of 4 or more.

Reviews.Title: “great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: socal4me
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last decade and it has not failed to be an excellent choice for a stay in the San Diego area. For this stay, we booked a 'snooze and cruise' package, we stayed one night pre-cruise, left our car in the lot, took the hotel shuttle to/from the cruise port and everything worked out very smoothly. On the morning of the cruise, we had breakfast at the hotel restaurant w/a window table overlooking the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's Half Moon is making improvements”
Reviews.Author: mushuBelfast
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Humphrey's Half Moon six times in the last seven years. I have really got attached to the place, the location is beautiful , a good base if you have a car, some nice eating options close by, the Humphrey's restaurant is good for breakfast with really good staff and the swimming pool is one of the best you will come across. I have had issues from time to time , especially during the concert season but they have always been dealt with. The improvements I have seen this year : some rooms have been renovated and better sound proofing has been installed, the front desk staff are more helpful and pleasant , the staff that were supervising the car parks during the concerts were more pleasant and helpful to residents of the hotel. The concierge and the staff in the breakfast restaurant are always brilliant. This hotel should have a much higher rating on tripadvisor, not enough people who have enjoyed the hotel have made the effort to report back about it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: pertzsch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a meeting she had. I thought the room and hotel average. Weather was cool so pool etc were out. Room was ok with nothing to rave about. I just think for the area, San Diego, there were better places for the conference that would have been nicer and cheaper. The Sheraton on Harbor Island was nicer and better for the price. Computer center here a little different and not very private. Staff was nice and had some good information on the Point Loma area. Liked San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sdsurfergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night for a mini "staycation". When we entered the room , we immediately wanted to leave. The room was outdated and had a musty odor. The bathroom had been updated but the rest of the room and carpet looked (and smelled) like it hadn't been updated since the 60s! Our key didn't work and we had to go to the front desk to ask for a new one. The front desk lady insisted that we were doing something wrong and said that the security guard would help us unlock the door. We waited for 15 minutes and finnally the front desk lady walked with us to our room and opened the door. Turns out you have to lift the handle up instead of down to open the door. She could have just told us that instead of making us feel like we were idiots! We were looking forward to soaking in the outdoor spa. When we arrived there was a huge mountain of foam on top and a strong odor of chlorine. It was so uninviting and I had never seen that much foam on a hot tub. Something was definately wrong so we skipped it!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing unique setting that is truly a delight!”
Reviews.Author: SandraLee222
Reviews.Content: Driving up to the tiki torches, lush tropical setting, balmy bay breeze, and warm welcome and service is like stepping into an exotic getaway. Once here - this is a place you want to stay and relax in - even if you have business to do, it's nice to know you can take a morning walk along the waterfront, take in a concert, enjoy the sumptuous cuisine, hot tub and get a fabulous massage. On top of all of that, it's a fabulous value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, be aware you have to pay to Park in the hotel and children are not allowed in the bar area to eat etc”
Reviews.Author: Vinnie04
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. We were lucky to have a refurbished room with a garden view. Very Clean and spacious. However, we were shocked when we arrived at reception to be told we had to pay $10 a day to park our car outside of our hotel room!! We were not made aware of this prior to booking. We arrived at the hotel around 2/3pm ish. It was a beautiful day so we thought we would grab a drink from the hotel bar and go and sit and look at the Marina. When we approached a member of staff, we were told the bar didn't open until 4pm and our Son was not allowed in as he was not over 21! Something else we were not aware of. We would never have booked this hotel if we knew both these things. (clearly not family friendly) Please be aware of this before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel made to feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: holidayreviewer48
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed herew in September with my sister, brother in law and their two children. We both had refurbished rooms with garden views. Having read the reviews on this site I was apprehensive when I arrived. As soon as we saw our rooms all reservations disappeared. The rooms were very clean and were cleaned very well each day, also you could not hear much noise from neighbouring rooms just sounds that you would usually hear in any other hotel. It was my Sister's birthday the day before we arrived, when she entered her room the hotel had provided a large fuit platter with chocolates as well as champagne as a surprise which was very much appreciated. The grounds and pool were great for the children. Also worth making use of the free bike hire the children really enjoyed this. With regard to the charge for parking, this is clearly advised in all the brochures and is no more expensive than we have paid many times before at other hotels the USA. In addition the restaurant was great, not expensive if you take into account the surroundings and the quality of food. To sum up we had a fantastic time - do not be put off by the reviews - ask for a refurbished room you wil have a fantastic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Narrabeeners
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights with my family of 5 in a garden suite. it was our first time to SD and chose this based on other reviews and was not disappointed. It is not a glitzy 5 star resort, instead it is a very clean and comfortable 'polynesian' property with a marina at the back with the front of the property having views of SD skyline. It was good to stay over this side of SD because I dont think the Gaslamp quarter or Old Town are as kid friendly and we had a car to get around so being out of the centre was fine. only complaint is the parking charge, overnight street parking is not allowed in the area. Staff were friendly and the tour desk girl was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: OCmomof2810
Reviews.Content: We love Humphreys! It is not in the middle of downtown so it is very quiet! Yet it is still close to major attractions! The grounds are very tropical and gorgeous. Our room was done up in a spa motiff, so it was very relaxing. We will definitely be staying at Humphreys whenever we getaway to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disapointment.”
Reviews.Author: Wonderar
Reviews.Content: Check-in went ok although thought receptionist a bit cool. Had to ask for restaurant discount coupons. First impression of our room was that it was dingy and so dull. Well in need of a makeover. Really liked the private patio area though that faced over the San Diego Bay area - ideal for morning coffee. Interior grounds and gardens were beautifully kept and very lush. Found the water in the pool to be quite cold for our liking, just managed to have a quick dip and out. Hotel is a bit isolated but the bus stop is a good 7 minute walk away if you prefer to leave the car behind. We paid $10 a day to park which is a rip off really as where else can you park? There is free street parking but it has time limits to it. The view across the bay from our room at the front of the hotel was beautiful at night with San Diego all lit up. By day it was possible to see the USS Midway with binoculars plus the ferries and cruise ships. Found the bed to be really comfortable but the pillows thin and full of lumps! The top of the plug plunger in the washbasin kept coming off and the plug hole looked a bit rusty. More then time for a complete makeover. John Legend was in concert whilst we were here although being Brits we had never heard of him - it was possible to sit round the pool and listen to the concert for free. Would we come back again? Yes for the actual grounds and views, no for the rooms, even the carpet was 'walking' near the bathroom entrance - very easy to trip if you were a bit unsteady on your feet. Overall sorry to say, the hotel left us a bit cold. A bit of a disapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TRIHARDEngland
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location on Shelter Island. The grounds are fabulous planted like a tropical paradise complete with humming birds. Great pool 25m for a proper swim but loads of shallow end for kids to play. Recommend a "view suite" which will either give you a garden or Marina view. These rooms are clean, large and well equipped. Our rooms decor was a little tired but they are working through upgrading them. The concert venue is unique as a hotel guest you get to eavesdrop on the concerts and they are always over by 10pm so it is not a noise nusiance. Parking is $10 a night so budget for this as there is no alternative overnight parking in the area. You do need a car to get the most from San Diego. We stayed for 2 weeks in the Humphreys and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Rough start, made right”
Reviews.Author: socalbc05
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at Humphrey's for years. We always have a great relaxing time. What makes Humprey's our choice is the suites. We have and teen and elementary girls and two 2 year old twins. A standard room just doesn't cut it anymore. Having lots of room and a full kitchen makes for a much more pleasant stay.We booked a Grand marina suite for the first week of August. When we arrived, the room was a mess! The carpet was dirty and there were several large red stains (looked like spilled drinks). The patio was covered in mashed in bread and food, and there were half empty water bottles and dozens and dozens of cigarette butts. Okay, dirty floors and cig butts and not cool when you have two toddlers! We called the front desk and someone came and cleaned up some (not all) of the mess outside. I talked to someone at the front counter who sounded sorry, but didn't really do anything. She said she would tell the manager. The first night was awful. My wife walked around in white socks and after a couple of hours the bottoms were BLACK. It was so bad we talked about leaving the next morning and just going home. That night I read the postings on tripadvisor and saw that Dawn Sanders responded to a few. The next morning my wife and I asked to meet with Dawn in private. I explained what had happened and our disappointment in our favorite hotel. Dawn was genuinely concerned, explained that the suites had not yet been renovated. I told her that the room was okay...it just needed a real good cleaning and that the cleaning staff didn't seem motivated to fix problems that were pointed out. Dawn understood and asked for a chance to make it right or send us to another property for the rest of the week. While we were out Dawn had our carpets cleaned with a "dry foam" that made a huge difference. The red stains were all but gone and out feet stayed clean when walking on the carpet. I think they should clean the carpets at least once a week. Here's the nice part. I specifically told Dawn that the money really wasn't the issue for us...we just wanted a nice vacation in a clean hotel with our kids and we would pay more to stay elsewhere if need be. But after the room was cleaned to our satisfaction Dawn knocked half off our first night's stay. And then send a nice fruit/cookie/coffee platter to our room one of the nights (a REAL hit with the kids). They also sent a note offering us a free in room movie that week. All in all, Dawn KNOWS how to take care of customers. She couldn't make the room perfect (it is older...) but she went above and beyond in making us feel liked valued guests. I ate at the restaurant a couple of times with the older girls that week...a bit pricey, but really good! On our last day we checked out and Dawn was there. I asked for another 25% discount voucher because we were going to grab a quick lunch with all the kids and then drive home. After settling the bill, Dawn gave me a certificate that paid for lunch for everyone. We already were happy with the hotel...we already paid the bill. But Dawn bought us lunch on the way out anyway. Again, Dawn Sanders is a great asset to Humphrey's! We WILL be back! The moral of the story is this: if you have ANY issues, don't complain, don't grumble, and don't keep it to yourself. Let Dawn know and I guarantee she will do everything to fix the problem and make you feel valued as a customer and guest.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, lovely location, great pool, lovely relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1981London
Reviews.Content: Loved it! the hotel is laid back but still has a five star feel. Rooms are large, make sure that you are not over looking the car park, we paid an extra $10 per night and upgraded to a lovely garden view. The staff are friendly and eager to please, the pool was lovely and relaxing, with a great pool bar and jazz being played. The restaurant is amazing and well worth paying a bit extra for, and the back stage bar is great fun, with happy hour and live music. Hotel guests do not pay to get in. Would defiantly go back there for longer that the 4 nights we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bbkbcbkb
Reviews.Content: We were in room 439 and it was not like the positive writeups and pictures. We were in a cramped, old smelling, dirty and outdated room. The surfacing on the stairs leading to the room were peeling and there was rotted sections of wood. Gum was stuck on the patio floor. The windows were dirty with greasy fingerprints from a previous traveller. The bathroom tiles were moldy and the grout had seen better days. The bathroom fixtures were worn and rusty. The airconditioning vent had thick black gobs of dust. The carpet was old and stained. We don't even want to know what was in the fabric headboards. The curtains were stained and dirty. We tried to switch rooms but they were booked full. We paid $10/day for parking and had ants in the rental car when we had no spills or food in the car. My children had noticed lots of ants in the parking lot the previous day. We stayed 3 out of 10 nights and then switched to a different hotel at a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Redwitchdiver
Reviews.Content: Originally booked for 4 days but extended to a week as we liked San diego so much. This hotel is on the bay and you can get some stunning views, depending on room - ours was not one of these but was ok. Staff very helpful and the hotel has lots of concerts on, including some big names at reasonable prices (Tracy Chapman was on night before we arrived and Beach Boys scheduled for after we left) as well as more local talent in the bar. We did not attend any but they looked well attended and overall the hotel is pretty good. Could possibly do with a bot of refurbishment in the bedrooms but had everything we needed. Downside is $10 per day to park there, I do not know how any hotel justifies parking charges when you are staying there and spending money with them anyway! Would recommend it though and some great restaurants nearby that we frequented.

Reviews.Title: “I will recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sandovalmaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel this past June, I took my family and nephews to Sea World and I just have to say this hotel was soo calm, clean, and the beds were just great!!!! Everyone was soo nice and polity, I do have to admit though the rooms are very small for the price. On my next trip I will be staying at the Humprey's.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conn06
Reviews.Content: I have to say I don't understand the odd poor review this place gets. The rooms were good, the pool is great, and the pool bar was always open at the stated times. We had two rooms by the pool, and they were clean and modern. I didn't hear anyone complaining. The concert venue is close by, but always ends by 10 pm. We even got to listen to Earth Wind and Fire for free! Shop around for a good rate and it is well worth it. The area is good, the Island is relaxing, the views are fantastic, and the Bali Hai restaurant is worth a visit...

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have stayed in!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCrawbutt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 11 nights and it was horrible! We were shown to disgusting rooms which were dirty and the air conditioning didn't work. We complained and were given rooms facing the garden and pool. These rooms were dated and not very clean. The door had a gap under it and insects etc could easily get in. The staff had a bad attitude and you could always hear people shouting and complaining at reception. The pool bar had a mind of its own - it shut when the barman decided he had enough for the day!! This hotel should be pulled down and modernised. It was AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like we were in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: HeavenlyTraveling
Reviews.Content: Every summer, right before school starts, my husband and I take our daughters to San Diego for an end of summer getaway. We have yet to stay at the same hotel twice, but from now on we'll be staying at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn. We felt like we were in Hawaii. Upon arrival, our first impression was of a tropical resort, from the architecture of the hotel, to the room decore, to the landscaping. Really beautiful. Our daughters enjoyed the tropical pool, while my husband and I had a fun game of ping pong before relaxing in the jacuzzi. On Friday night we were treated to one of Humphrey's famous concerts. Humphrey's is located very close to Old Town, a short drive to the zoo and Balboa Park, and a bunch of really good restaurants. Humphrey's is great. Great for family fun, great for a romantic getaway, and great if you just want to relax by the pool. We'll be back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhh! Keep this gem a secret!”
Reviews.Author: LisaZ1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was delightful. It was a find! I will definitely be back again. My room looked over the garden/pool. On the night of the Moody Blues sold-out concert, I just opened my windows and heard the best free concert! It was a great "totally chilled", "relaxed" environment. I was so impressed, I bought tickets for the next nights concert, even though I easily could have enjoyed it from my hotel room. That night, the concert was from the Hawaiian islands. It was Ledward Ka`apana from Hui O'Hana fame, and Hapa, and John Cruz - grammy award winner. What a beautiful, intimate venue, with the yachts on one side, and the rest of the bay on the other, and the stars in the sky overhead. Loved it! I'm almost afraid to let the word out about this hotel, on trip advisor - I definitely want to buy tickets to another great concert there, and then walk a few steps back to my room! Thanks! Lisa Z.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitelly go back to Humphrey's Half Moon Inn.”
Reviews.Author: phoenixsuns
Reviews.Content: I was planning a one week vacation to San Diego for me and my husband, but did not want to spend to much on the hotel, as our buget was limited. I did some research and I was able to find a great rate for this hotel, but only for the first three nights, after that it would be almost double. So we decided to spend three nights at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn and the other four nights at Hampton Inn Sea World - where I was also able to find a great rate - all through Expedia. Everything was great at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn and we were actually sad when we left. We got a nice room on the first floor, with view to the Marina. There was a small patio where you could enjoy the view and the coffee in the morning. The room was spacious, the bathroom was huge with granite counter tops. And there is also a magnifying mirror ... which was really cool... I haven't seen that in a hotel before. The hotel has a restaurant (which seemed pretty expensive, but they give you 25% off coupons when you check-in) and a very nice bar. What was great about the bar was that they have happy hour every day from 5 to 7. We ate there once and it was $5.50 for a burger and fries, and $2 a beer. Pretty good deal. And they also have bands playing, I'm not sure how often, but that was cool. Everything about this hotel says vacation and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation with Family ever”
Reviews.Author: sdukes
Reviews.Content: Our Family stayed at Humphreys June 27 through July 1. My husband and I along with our two children and their friends stayed at this wonderful hotel. We had previously stayed at a new hotel downtown attending a conference June 25 and 26. While the new hotel was beautiful it was extremely expensive and ultimately not as kid friendly as Humphreys was. The staff at Humphreys went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. I visited Humphreys a day ahead of our check in to make sure we were getting a room that would work well for our family - we had reserved a suite and a regular room and wanted to make sure the kids were fairly close to us for safety purposes. I called the next day and the reservationist was able to share with me the rooms that had been assigned to us and really put my anxiety to rest. She did her best to put the kids close to us and gave us a room we were thrilled with - the view was great and we were more than satisfied. We checked in that afternoon and the kids were thrilled with the tropical atmosphere of the entire hotel. Being able to check our emails in the lobby was super, the pool was great and the service around the pool superior as well. In fact our last day we stayed at the hotel and lounged around the pool, ate room service and drinks by the pool. The service staff was always friendly and efficient. Our vehicle was hit in the parking lot and the security personnel was right on it because the driver drove away. He was able to secure a license plate from a hotel guest and went above and beyond to make sure harbor police was called and followed up to make sure our needs were met. Wow what a great experience given the circumstance. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. They are in the process of modernizing all the rooms and that will prove to be great. One of our rooms was completed and the flat screen tvs, bed linens and all was superior. While our suite was older it still was very nice and we were very pleased. The toaster, pots and pans were older and some didn't work well but when I brought it to the attention of staff they indicated all I had to do was ask and they would be replaced. The TV in our bedroom didn't work at 10 p.m. one night - a staff period replaced the tv and made sure our needs were met - everything we asked was met with incredible service. Someone is training and motivating staff they right way. The only downside was I felt the cleaning staff were not as friendly and was rushing us so they could clean the rooms and be done. Kudos to Humprheys staff and all that made our stay great.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: nakitataz
Reviews.Content: The room was good and clean. there were some problems with the bathroom but I call and they fix them right away. HSKP dept did a really good job on clean the room for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway!”
Reviews.Author: fanatictraveler
Reviews.Content: We read mixed review about Humprhey and did not know what to expect. We requested a room not in building A (Building A is near the concert area). We also wanted a newly remodeled suite. Prior to our visit, Humphrey was nice enough to send us an email to inform us that the suites are not in bldg A, however, the suites were not yet remodeled and they offered us 2 standard remodeled rooms. We decided to stay in the suite since our teens wanted to stay together. The suites are roomy, with a outside patio area. The pool area is also very nice... our 2 teen boys played ping pong in the pool area for hours... we stayed in bldg L which was on the other end hotel area....The hotel is like a small little resort... short driving distance to La Jolla, UCSD, Mission Beach, old Town area... Humphrey exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: KCTRAVELKansasCity
Reviews.Content: Very old property and room had not been updated. Overpriced for what we got. Only bright spot was pool bartender. Resteraunt had food that looked nice but tasted very average and we got pretty poor service, i.e. overcharged, did not bring meals at the same time, forgot salad, etc. Many nicer places to stay for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here”
Reviews.Author: GMcCarthy
Reviews.Content: We had the most horrific experience of are lives here. An intruder came into our room while we slept. My girlfriend awoke and screamed and he fled out the patio door. The hotel tried to cover it up. We had to call the police and report it. A nightmare.I have stayed here prior for concerts and had no problems. I hope it was a one time ordeal. They offered to discount our next stay, are you kidding me. I visit san diego often and there are plenty of places to stay. I wouldn't wish this on anyone. Do your homework and read all reviews. Downtown would make for a nicer vacation., Unfortunately, the area just outside Shelter Island has become increasingly seedy. If you stay, lock your doors and patio!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: goose1166
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a junior suite which was roomy. There's a mini-fridge, a microwave, coffeemaker and two TVs. The bed is kind of separated from the sitting area. The only thing was the balcony's view was partially blocked by a palm tree. The bartenders in the lounge were very nice and friendly. There was music on the two nights we were there. I liked the location of the hotel -- it's on Shelter Island which is within 10 minutes of Old Town and Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Carpet mites, broken faucet and an attitude!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_for_fun6009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 108 of this hotel for one night on Saturday, May 23rd. The staff all seemed to have their noses in the air, like badly trained employees at a very posh hotel (which of course, expect their people to be gracious and accommodating to guests). The "Ritz" attitude was terribly at odds with the level of service and the reality of cleanliness and maintenance of our room. Our niece and nephew were in another room where their dirty wine glasses from Friday evening were still in the room on Sunday afternoon. When we walked in at 10:30pm, we discovered the faucet handle of the bathroom sink had come off, and was neatly placed next to its broken socket. The following morning, we discovered that the carpet was infested with tiny white mites, visibly crawling along dark surfaces. When I brought this to the attention of the Front Desk at check out. I was advised to take these issues to the General Manager of the hotel. I said "No thanks, I'd rather take them to Trip Advisor!" There are so many other choices for lodging in San Diego--don't pick this turkey!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: binkydiva
Reviews.Content: The mixed reviews made me a bit nervous but we had a great time! Beautiful grounds - great pool - good location and staff was wonderful. You really could not ask for more for some R&R. (we did request an updated room - which we got - it was very nice!) The weather was not the greatest but we really did not mind. The free bike rental was great!! Be sure to visit during concert season...the line-up looked excellent! Thank you Humphrey's!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown but feels miles away”
Reviews.Author: Keagriver
Reviews.Content: I visit San Diego regularly on business but have never found a place that I'm crazy about so when I saw this hotel on Trip Advisor, I thought I'd give it a try. My first impression was pretty kitschy, but despite the tikis and abundance of bamboo, it's comfortable and the grounds are beautiful: lovely garden environment and a great pool. The Point Loma location is convenient: 5 minutes to the airport (but not under the flight path), and it's easy to get downtown on Harbor Drive. In a few free hours one afternoon, I borrowed a hotel bike and pedaled all the way down to the USS Midway, a fun little adventure. Free wireless, a bar sink and fridge, and friendly staff made this feel more like a little getaway and less like a business trip. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: junesflame
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend with my husband and one year old baby. The location of the hotel is in a very nice boating/yachting community with several great restaurants (we ate at Brigante) within walking distance. Also, the hotel is maybe 15 minutes from the airport and very easy to find. We arrived for check-in early and just expected to dump off our luggage and sight see a bit, but wonderfully our room was all ready and we could check-in. The desk staff were very courteous and kind and allowed us to choose between a courtyard or city view. The hotel has a very fun tropical theme with a beautiful courtyard and pool area -- great for playing in the water with the family or for sunbathing. The view from our room was gorgeous and we could see the city lights at night. We expected to pay for parking as this is the case with most of the hotels in the area and I was warned of this on my reservation -- there is public parking across the street for the thrifty. The only downfall was our room. We reserved a junior suite and the room was small and the furnishings were very dated. The room was in Bldg A and was in desperate need of an update (furnishings/wallpaper/comforter) and strangely you enter the suite through the bedroom not the living room area and room set-up was definitely awkward. The room was functional though, the bed comfy and the view definitely helped, but we spent most of our days sightseeing so we didn't come for the room and moreso the location. Sadly my first morning there, I had no hot water and had to call down to the front desk. They quickly fixed the problem though because within 30 minutes or so there was hot water. A mixed review for me. I might come back for the location and if I could stay in one of the updated buildings or in the building I stayed in for only a short time.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: 1crazymama
Reviews.Content: Our stay was amazing! We were in bldg M on the lower floor. When you open the door to your patio the water is about 15 feet away. The rooms are very nice and we could not hear any noise from people around us. We are planning another trip just so we can stay there!!!! WOW!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exotic Stay”
Reviews.Author: xaak
Reviews.Content: We (2ad, 2 ch) had here a two nights stay coming from Grand Canyon. GrandCanyon to SanDiego in one day is doable – we had the helicopter tour at 10:45 and at ~12:00 left to SanDiego passing Sedona and I8, arriving at the hotel before 21:00 with 3 stops. The crossing of Sedona and the adjoining Oak Creek was extremely beautiful. We had a 2 Queen room with partial bay view. The room was close to restaurant and has noise from it’s air-conditions. Ask for room close to the reception (not to the restaurant), and in the 2nd floor since they have private balcony. The downstairs coin laundry – dry machines proved to be very useful. We searched to find any vending machine for a refreshment but without success. WiFi was working in my windows mobile phone (wm6, omnia). I ask for WiFi and they gave to me a username/password without charging it. The hotel is VERY exotic, and a night swimming in the pool (closes at 23:00) very relaxing. A complimentary breakfast and parking would add more value. Parking is no problem in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: rasjve
Reviews.Content: The grounds are really nice, but my problem was the noise. At around 2 am, there were people outside talking REALLY LOUD and it went on for about an hour.... I could also hear the people upstairs moving around. When we checked out our room, we found spiders on towels and on the bed... good thing I checked first before going to bed...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...but noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: DrDanB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Half Moon Inn for two nights, and we were very fortunate to have received the complimentary upgrade to a Marina-View Suite. We had a wonderful, very relaxing view of the Marina, as well as being provided with a very spacious suite. The suite had a king-size bed, plenty of closet space, a kitchenette fully-stocked with cutlery, plates, etc.. The bathroom was a pleasant surprise, with marble counter tops and ample space. Two sinks made it very easy for us to prepare at the same time, unlike many hotels we have stayed in. The grounds are FANTASTIC, with well-kept foliage reminding us of our trip to Hawaii. The pool area was always busy, even though it was a bit chilly (65-70 degrees). I particularly enjoyed the two parrots that are perched above the koi pond. I very nice touch of the tropics. The concert venue is very impressive. The stage was not used while we were there, but I can see why such great bands would wish to perform there. A beautiful, yet intimate concert environment, overlooking the marina and surrounded by the beautiful, tropical gardens of the Half Moon Inn. Although my wife and I enjoyed the service of the staff, the clean, spacious, very comfortable rooms, and the outstandingly beautiful campus, I do have a complaint that has been made in previous posts I have read on this site. I found that the room that we were provided, which I am certain is one of the more expensive rooms available, was extremely poor as far as noise abatement. I could literally hear EVERY word that the neighbors were saying next door if I stood in our closet area. The ventilation system served as a direct line of communication between the two suites. The room which adjoined our bedroom was not occupied on our first night, and I slept like a baby. The comfort of the pillows and linens was 5-star, certainly meeting the standard of some of the best hotels we have stayed in around the world. The final night of our stay, however, was a nightmare! I heard the couple whose bed was on the other side of the wall from our bed were talking into the "wee hours", and I could literally hear every word. I decided that instead of making my wife uspet on our last night, for she was sleeping like a baby throughout the conversation next door, I decided to sleep in the sofa in the living room. If I had knocked on the wall it would have escalated into a confrontation, and that is not what we expected when we booked our stay at the Half Moon Inn. A final word of advice to those who stay in room 422...the drapes do NOT close completely in the bedroom, and the morning light can wake you up very early. We simply brought along a "bag clip" that we use for closing bags of chips, and it worked like a charm to keep the drapes from having an annoying slit where the light came in.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but spoilt by car park fee”
Reviews.Author: dundeetripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of weeks ago and had a 2 double bed oversize suite booked. We had a full kitchen and a seperate bedroom area which could be closed off from the living area by a sliding door. This was ideal for us with a young family our 3 year old son and 9 month old daughter could go to bed and we could relax in the living area. It was a bit tatty, and the paint was flaking in patches. we had a view of the harbour and my son enjoyed feeding the duck which came to our patio door each morning. the maid came every day and the accomodation was always spotless. Try asking for a harbour view as they are much better than the views in the opposite direction. Parking was plentiful but expensive $15 per day is a rip off i would rather they included it in the rate. We didn't eat at the restaurant but did receive a voucher at check in for 20% off. Some of the other rooms are being upgraded and have flat screen tv's. Its not far to balboa park and seaworld and there is a vons supermarket a short drive away. Finally the grounds are very nice and tropical and the towels are plentiful at the pool.
