I think it should be higher up on the tripadvisor list ( maybe its the car park charge which is bringing it down) management take note. There is a small beach area across the road from the hotel with bbq facilities etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at Humphreys”
Reviews.Author: Bar-steward
Reviews.Content: Rooms were slightly dated in their decorations but clean and comfortable and our room had a poolside patio.The pool was large and there was ping-pong and mini golf.The restaurant and bar were at one end of the spread out property. As a music venue (open air in summer) it could not be described as quiet. Its location by the yacht marina first class.Other restaurants were a good 10 min walk away,as was the bus into town.The bar had happy hour (everything half price) early evening,and the bar food good and reasonably priced. Food in the restaurant was top class although not cheap. We enjoyed our stay at Humphreys and would find it difficult not to return should we go back to San Deigo.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...But”
Reviews.Author: Smithills
Reviews.Content: We spent last week at Humphrey's and loved every second of our stay. The staff were great, and the view from our room(442), over the marina was a joy. Great food at the restaurant, great live music in the bar and you're only a short taxi ride away from most places that you want to go. We loved it! Now, for the "But". We were very lucky to have quiet neighbours during our stay. You will need to be lucky too, because the sound proofing from one room to the other is very, very poor. I awoke one night, to answer natures call, and could clearly hear snoring coming from next door. I've noted that the rooms are being improved, and that sound proofing improvements are being included in this process. We will happily stay at Humphreys again, but only if we can get a room that has addressed the sound proofing issues. God help you if you have a room beside twentysomething partiers. When you book, make sure that you go for a room that has had a renovation. This is really important, and that's what we'll do when we next stay at this hotel, and we ARE going to stay at this hotel again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: mkrmls
Reviews.Content: Humphrey's has got to be the best kept secret in San Diego. Nicely updated - clean rooms. You feel as if you are in Hawaii - the grounds are beautiful. Great live entertainment every night. The restaurant has fantastic food and a beautiful view although I don't think the weitress really wanted to be working. We will defiantly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Made a great memory”
Reviews.Author: deerfieldHouston
Reviews.Content: My second stay at Humphrey's. 1st was business, was so impressed I brought my wife for our anniversary. A really beautiful location, with 1st class service and assistance. Donna Frey handled all our needs- car, tickets, reservations, schedules, and driving directions for restaurants and events. An anniversary we won't forget.

Reviews.Title: “Beware front desk staff! They may yell at you!”
Reviews.Author: Leonida85
Reviews.Content: I thought everyone in San Diego was super nice and friendly, until I met Melissa at the front desk of this hotel! We were initially trying to decide between this hotel and a beautiful 4 star hotel downtown where public transportation is easier. I called Humphrey's and asked how guests can get around from the hotel and was told that there was a complimentary shuttle to the airport. Seeing that buses leave from the airport, we booked Humphrey's and saved a few dollars. When our flight got into the airport at 11pm, I called the hotel and asked for the shuttle. I was told that the shuttle ended at 11 pm, but to take a cab and get a receipt and we would be reimbursed at the end of our stay. We used the hotel shuttle to get to the airport two days to take the bus downtown, and once to pick up our rental car. No one ever told us that we were not allowed to be using the shuttle this way. Nor is it explicitly stated anywhere. It DOES NOT say "Arrivals and departures only" anywhere. Upon checkout, I asked Melissa at the front desk about the cab reimbursement. I was told, forcefully and indignantly, that "Absolutely not! We will not reimburse you!" because that was not their policy. It didn't matter that we were told this by the front desk when we first called. We were, I kid you not, YELLED at by Melissa in the lobby in front of other guests, because we had used the shuttle to go to the airport on consecutive days. We were essentially accused of lying about what we were told by the staff on the first night, and essentially accused of trying to get away with something by using the shuttle in the way we did. So, not only did we not get reimbursed when we were told we would, we were humiliated in the lobby in the process. I have never been treated this way by someone in customer service! DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, relaxing place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Secondsacker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three day weekend, and upon leaving, wished that we could stay for another week. We booked the largest suite, as we had six in our party. There was plenty of room, and the kitchenette worked great for morning breakfasts. The view of the harbor was awesome. The courtyard flora absolutely awesome - just like being on the islands. Pool and hot tub area are very cool. I only wish that we were there in the summer to take part in the summer concerts. Restaurant was a bit pricey, but that's what vacations are all about - food was really good. Location made it easy to go North to SeaWorld and beaches, or around the bay to downtown and waterfront. 15 minute drives tops. Those folks that dis this hotel have got to be spoiled or have unrealistic expectations. Having read a negative review or two, I was a shade nervous - but I knew after stepping on the property, our stay was going ot be great. Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaLadyDi
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that I would absolutely recommend to my friends. My family (six of us) stayed in a Grand Marina Suite and it worked perfectly for us - beautiful rooms and view! The staff was helpful and kind, and the location was good. A little construction close by, but not a big deal at all. The restaurant was not to our liking (expensive), but we easily found other places to eat. All in all - a great place to stay and we plan on coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work!”
Reviews.Author: ClassCounts
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were great - very helpful, cheerful, knowledgeable and efficient. The food at the restaurant was wonderful as well. I really liked the layout of the Junior Suite. (A floorplan is on their website.) And we got a great deal booking on their web site. This could have been my new favorite hotel in San Diego! BUT, the room was just plain dowdy - stained carpet and sofa, insufficient lighting - except for the glaring light from outside through the curtains that didn't quite close. However, the desk staff said the hotel is gradually being updated - so request a room that has been spruced up! You CAN see water from the water view side - across a wide boulevard and two parking lots, and on the far side of a public restroom. I would recommend the marina side - based on the very pretty view of the boats from the restaurant. Location is not bad if you have a car - but not very convenient if you plan to use public transportation. Surprisingly quiet given proximity to airport.

Reviews.Title: “we had planned one night - and staid for the rest of our trip”
Reviews.Author: hanseata
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. We liked the hotel's quiet but central location, and found its tropical gardens and beautiful views on yacht harbor and coastline very relaxing. The food was excellent, so that we dined more often in than we usually do on a trip. I enjoyed my daily swimming in the heated outdoor pool, especially in the evening when the gardens were lit. My husband used the gym and had a really good massage on the premises. We also found the staff very knowledgeable and helpful. We would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Location”
Reviews.Author: flygirl46ohio
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel to just relax in. This hotel was perfect. Comfortable clean rooms, close to downtown and airport. Was walking distance to restaurants and bay was across the street from hotel. Nice views of city. Very close to Point Loma. Would stay here again. Be sure and ask for 25% discount for restaurant when you check in. We were not offered this and then heard staff offering to other guest later on. When we did ask about it we were told we could get it now, but we were ready to check out and had already ate in restaurant, which we had lunch. The restaurant has a beautiful view of the harbor and boats and the food was good. Staff at resturant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel location, but....”
Reviews.Author: ScottRick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough, and the location very nice. The concierge -- a woman named Donna, however, was no help at all. For lunch she suggested some filthy hole in the wall restaurant that I didn't even want to sit in, much less order food at. We late found this very nice restaurant on our own -- across the street from the hotel! The concierge also recommended a city tour package that was way overpriced for what we got out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: angie76ks
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and affordable, location perfect. Couldn't complain about anything. They aim to please.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LeeRae
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for my son's Marine Corp bootcamp graduation. We stayed at this hotel for four nights. My mother stayed additional evening. We arrived at the airport at 10:15 am and I called the hotel to let them know we had arrived and if there was a possibility of checking in early. The lady was very friendly and told me she would let housekeeping know we would be an early check-in. We went to get our rental car and by the time we got to Humphrey's our room was ready. We asked at check-in for a roll away bed and it was delivered within five minutes of getting into our room. They showed us a map of the property and gave us a choice of room location. We picked a second floor room overlooking the bay. No disappointments there. We enjoyed the view a lot. The naval base is directly across the bay and we saw helicopters and huge ships coming and going. We even saw planes taking off from an aircraft carrier. We saw cruise ships and harbor tour boats also. We had a Waterview Jr. Suite. It had a king bed and a sofa bed. Plus the roll away bed. Plenty of room for four of us. Seeing we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room. They do not have rooms with two bathrooms so I was worried about all of us getting ready in the mornings. There is a sink with a large mirror between the bedroom area and sitting area. So that could be used for getting ready. There is a sink and vanity outside the shower/toilet area. Plenty of drawers and closet space. The room was cleaned nicely everyday. The front desk staff were fantastic. If we'd ask if there was a Pizza place we could order from they had menus handy and would print directions to anywhere you needed. They printed us directions to a Walgreens. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The concierge was very helpful also. They suggested a Mexican restaurant a few blocks away and gave us a coupon for a free appetizer. The appetizer was great and so was everything else at the restaurant. It is Miguel's. The food was very good and the staff were great there too. We ate there twice. After graduation we took a group of 13 there. We had a little one with us and the wait would have been 45 minutes for a table. But, they set up a table for us outside. It was probably about 72 degrees and it was so special for my son's family to all be together having a great meal and eating outside was a treat. Seeing at home it was around zero degrees. My hubyy and I went whale watching and my mom and daughter went to Sea World. My mom and I drove to La Jolla to see sea lions and my mom went to the Zoo also. Nice area. Loved San Diego. The front desk has information or discount coupons for all events in the area. The bar at Humpohrey's is nice. A bit pricey, compared to our midwestern bars, but there really isn't a comparison. Great live music. Reggae one night. It was great to be out and dancing. So festive feeling. We really felt like the whole stay was a celebration. Nothing to complain about. There are going to be doing some remodeling of the lobby area. From what we were told they are redoing the gift shop area and adding more seating and lounge area to the lobby. So everything in the gift shop was 70% off. Great deals. I bought a really nice hooded fancier type fleece jacket for $9 and because it was the last jacket they let me get the matching pants for free. I got another really nice San Diego (collegiate type lettered) sweatshirt for less than $7. We got other t-shirts and goodies too. When my hubby went into buy a soda they looked at me and said "oh you have supported our sale so much we won't charge you for the soda". My husband was like "how much money did you spend here?" Really not a lot at all. Anyway, our stay was great and I would recommend this hotel if you are in the area. We were charged for a newspaper daily, which we did not receive. I called and the charge was credited to us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place, Great place to stay for a week”
Reviews.Author: clkaka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and parked our car for a week while we to a cruise to Mexico. This hotel has nice rooms, very spacious, a little dated, but other than that, unless your lookin to find four seasons quality, that its not, but i certainly will stay there again, in fact my husband has to stay in san diego for work occasionally and this is where i want to stay when we come to town. The kitchens have everything that you need in drawers, and a nice full sized refrigerator, i defenitely will be coming back to Humphreys

Reviews.Title: “Top service and free concert”
Reviews.Author: rekasraah
Reviews.Content: Ending our nearly 4 week US trip with 2 nights at Humpreys gave us a smashing ending to our vacation. Checking in we were given a room overlooking the concert arena and stage. Not reflecting on this we were trilled with the concert the second evening with Ringo Starr and his all Starr Band - from the VIP deck in front of the hotel room - included in the room price. We even had access to the band training/practice in the afternoon. Thanks Humphreys - we will be back on our next US trip. The one thing we did miss during our stay was i.e. a lobby bar for drinks and coffey - as entering the restaurant/indoor club scene was no option due to cover charge and load music. Not suiting if you just want a cup of coffe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: chrisngary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with some co workers of my husbands stayed at this hotel for about a week in mid-october. The hotel grounds are very nice and mature. The pool/whirlpool area were clean. The restaurant and conference room were both tip top. The staff and concierge were more than eager to help in anyway possible. What I enjoyed the most was the fact that this place is on a a stretch where there is nothing but beautiful views of the skyline, the marine base, the planes coming in and out of the airport, the many, many yatchs and boats at the marinas. My morning jog along the water was out of this world. Great little walkway along the water....local fisherman on a small pier, seabirds and sealions.... Absolutely gorgeous! The only negative I would have would be the rooms. They were clean, but tired. They needed a facelift. They were old and outdated. HOWEVER, I must say that I noticed some construction going on. It appeared that they were "redoing" some of the rooms....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Place”
Reviews.Author: jenamoe
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and there for get wonderful rates, but I booked through their site because they were running a great special. I was there for 5 days for my nephews marine graduation which was no more then 10 minutes away next to the airport. The property was beautiful. Even in the cold weather (50's) the flowers were amazing. They big birds were even outside for us to talk to. They have an amazing large pool with a very spacious hot tub. You need a keycard to get into the pool area so its not crowded with other people from the area. The grounds are very clean and well taking care of. I even got caught picking a flower and one of the managers walked by and said, "Pretty aren't they?" LOL I was sooo red! I was there with 3 others. We would have had plenty of space in the regular room I booked, but when we got there, we upgraded to the suite on the bay. It was only $50 more a night and well worth it. We had a huge living room, big deck with 2 chairs, table and every morning we could feed the ducks right off our balcony. The bedroom had 2 large queen beds and both rooms had vaulted ceilings. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was HUGE with his and her sinks. The shower put out nice pressure as well. The best part of the suite is the room outside the bathroom. It had 2 large closets that were mirrored, a vanity table and chair in front of a wall mirror to do your makeup, hair, etc. That room had 2 doors so there was a good flow to the whole place. The kitchen was large and plenty of room to stay for a month if need be. Parking was $10 for the whole stay. That didn't bother me too much considering I was so happy about the place. At night, you feel very safe to walk around. Across the street is a boat ramp and pier where you can walk down and watch the sea lions swim around and yell at you :) You can see the sunset and downtown San Diego is lit up and right there to see. Its very romantic. There is lots of places to eat within minutes of the hotel. They are famous for their concerts as well. Check their time and dates. They are worth it. I called the front desk and coulnd't hear the man that answered, i was asking where to go eat. It was pouring down rain and the next thing I knew, he was knocking on the door, soaking wet with a piece of paper that told everywhere in the area. Their restaurant was on the high side. 3 of us topped off at $170 with tip. It was good food but not worth the price. They will give you a 25% discount but still. This is a perfect location for 1st time travelers there. I will for sure be staying here again. The people were so kind and they wanted to help with everything. Wonderful 1st time experience to san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: haughticmelody
Reviews.Content: To just get all the bad out of the way first I'll start with the cons that I ran into while staying at the hotel. The first issue was my neighbors. They were very inconsiderate, slamming the door at night. As mentioned before it's not the hotel's fault. The second was the I arrived after they stopped with the concerts. That was more my fault for not researching more of when the concerts run, however, their restaurant has live music each night. The pros. When I first contacted the property the reservations line was very helpful and didn't make me feel stupid. When I first arrived in San Diego I called the hotel a few times asking about the shuttle service, they sent out a shuttle right away to pick me up. The first thing that I have problems when I travel by plane is I try to travel as light as possible and then I tend to forget things that I actually needed like my toothbrush. I noticed that late night so I went to the front desk and asked. Vanessa provided me with the toothbrush and even some toothpaste. Then later that night I had questions so I went back to the front desk and Jennifer helped me with a list of things to do, and directions, both of them were very helpful with all the questions I had. And they didn't make me feel stupid when I had dumb questions either. The hotel itself is being renovated. The room I was in was very nice. I had the standard small fridge and a microwave, an iron and ironing board, a coffee maker, an alarm clock and a hair dryer. My bathroom had a heat lamp in it which was very nice. The hotel has a nice pool that I believe is heated and a spa. It is located by a private marina and on the other side there is a boating site. The hotel is located close to the airport so you do hear airplane noise every now and then, but, it was not even close to a problem. The fitness room isn't huge, but, it does have weights, bike, treadmill, and a step machine. The latter 3 all have televisions and plugs for your ipod. The lobby has StarBucks coffee in the morning and if you want breakfast you can go to their restaurant. The hotel is also close to a naval base, however it didn't pose any issues to my stay with loud noise are anything of the sort. This is an excellent hotel and will stay here many more times in the future because of the great people at the front desk that helped me and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Have great luck at Humphrey's!!”
Reviews.Author: NatureGurl
Reviews.Content: So I have noticed that there are some reviews where some folks must be having plain outn out bad luck at this wonderful property. We have been three times now and each time it has been an absolute dream. This last trip on the weekend of Nov 14-16th was outstanding. We booked a Jr suite and got a room with a yummy bed, robes to lounge around in, fridge, micro (w popcorn for popping), coffeemaker, and a wonderful patio that gave a splendid view of the marina, backside of the lounge area and faced directly the concert stage. The price was less than $175 a night! It was magical. Loved looking out and seeing the adorable parrot sitting in his paradise surroundings. We had room service again this time and since I ordered it before they started serving we received it in less that 30 minutes and it was very good! We went sightseeing to the Point Loma Lighthouse and throughout the San Diego coastline. We ate at Point Loma Seafood and the sushi was really fresh and yummy. Fiance had the clam strips and they were wonderful, crunchy not chewy at all! We had dinner at Brigadine right up the road from Humphrey's and had the best tacos EVER!!! and the bartender set me up with the best desert, a frozen mudslide with lots of hershey's chocolate and whip cream. I thoroughly enjoyed the trip and my fiance thinks we will never stay anywhere else again!! Sorry for those of you who had a bad experience:(

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff, great restaurant, great value”
Reviews.Author: ranger46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to visit our son who is stationed in San Diego and I had been told about Humphrey's by a friend who stays there regularly on business. I am not sure what guests from across the "pond" found so unagreeable about this place because my wife and I found it to be one of the best hotels we have stayed at in years. The staff is friendly and attentive, from the young lady with the "down under" accent who checked us in, to the beautiful young hostesses at the restaurant who seated us in a marina side table right at sunset. Speaking of the restaurant; it has to be at least 4 stars and I can see why the local San Diegans come here night after night. We were only here for two nights, but we cannot wait to come back. Great rate too. This was our first visit to San Diego and it truly is one of the most beautiful cities anywhere in the world. Humphrey's made it even more special. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow2008
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed with my stay at this hotel. The hotel was a lot bigger than I expected and the rooms were really dated. I do not know if they are planning on redecorating this place soon but it really needs it. The bathroom gives the impression that they need a really good clean and they possibly would not look so dated. The grounds of the hotel are nice but really nothing special and I guess that is the same impression of the hotel overall. The staff are very friendly but if you are looking for somewhere to stay that has a bit of sparkle that will remain in your memory for good reasons this place is not it. You will only be left with the bad memories of not getting any sleep because the beds are hard and the sheets feel dirty not to mention the noise of the air conditioning and wondering why you have spent this amount of money on a hotel that is akin to a poorly maintained roadside motel.

Reviews.Title: “Total dump!”
Reviews.Author: katetravels989
Reviews.Content: This place is a 2 star, tops! The shower/bath was old and dingy, wallpaper was peeling, spa needed re-plastering, mattresses were hard..... The lobby was nice, but the rooms needed a complete overhaul. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: guavabean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in a remodeled room that was beautiful. The staff was professional & very accomodating. Vanessa & Melissa at the front desk were most helpful. This property is one of the better in the nearby area. We decided to stay here since most others in the area were old style motels that didn't look very appealing or safe although they were brand name hotels. We didn't see a concert, but I think its an awesome spot to stay if you do since you won't have to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience,can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: TheoryKey
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. The pictures on the hotel's website were accurate and the grounds are beautiful - the pool and jacuzzi clean and well maintained, a great experience for our first trip to San Diego. I got scared right before we left on the trip as I saw some bad reviews posted, but a call to the hotel asking about renovations led to my being told that they were renovating some rooms with new refrigerators and microwaves and they would make sure I had a room with no repairs needed or in progress. We arrived early and they stored our luggage and although they were very busy they did get us into our room an hour earlier than posted check in time. The staff was wonderful - very cheerful and helpful. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. We had a king room with pool/garden view and I asked to be placed where we'd have the least noise from the concerts (my husband's a light sleeper) and they got that taken care of.The concerts that played onsite while we were there did not negatively impact us as far as the noise or the parking. Our room was a ground floor (I recommend this as it had a walk out patio with chairs while the 2nd floor rooms above us had windows but no balcony and sitting on the patio enjoying the wonderful San Diego evenings was a pleasure I wouldn't have missed). One reviewer said you could enjoy the concerts if you chose to and when you closed the wiondow, it closed off the sound and I agree for the most part. Some performers may be louder than others but the concerts are over by 11 so not a big deal. We did get charged for a daily newpaper that I never knew I was going to be charged for and never received, but when I called the hotel a couple days after leaving and explained I did not get a paper, they took it right off the bill - a very minor annoyance in an otherwise great experience. The hotel also offers use of a PC in the lobby so I was able to check in the day before our return flight and print our boarding passes - another great amenity. I also enjoyed the surrounding harbor and pathways along the harbor that can be used for walking or biking. There is a gaggle of ducks that hang around the front of the building but I discovered that at night, they walk through the grounds and go in the back to their "real" home - very funny to watch the procession! Overall, I highly recommend this to anyone who is unsure about where to stay in this city. You are close enough to the downtown area(4 miles) and can see the skyline from the hotel but the marina/harbor setting is WAY better than being in the city and it seemed that Humphreys could accomodate several levels of need from just needing a clean, comfortable room in a nice setting to full suites with room service. I can't WAIT to go back!

Reviews.Title: “our 2nd visit and we werent disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Judejones
Reviews.Content: We returned to Humphreys in September 08 after a LONG drive from Chicago. We stayed there last year and loved it. As music lovers, we hoped to see Etta james this year, (we did). We cannot compilment the staff enough, especially the front desk and concierge, who will bend over backwards to help you. We had a junior suite, which was perfect, and stayed 5 nights, only regret is that we didn't stay longer. The pool is warm and clean, there are clean fresh towels and a beautiful garden. The restaurant is wonderful, with a great new menu, the music as ever was awesome, we were very sorry to leave and return to windy rainy England.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL IS HORRIBLE DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: bri5468
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel in the past with decent results. Was in SD for the weekend and booked again because of the location. Staff was rude, rooms smelled and had major water leak problems to the point we were forced to switch rooms in the middle of the night. No offer to help with the bags and no apologizies from the hotel. It was obvious this water leak had been a problem for some time and neglected until it finally got much worse then night we were there. Someone could have gotten seriously injured going onto the restroom in the middle of the night with the amount of water that had leaked through the wall. Worst of all when contacting the general manager they basically said too bad we "upgraded your room". The upgrade was to a room whose lights didnt work, again smelled and was in the middle of the night and we were checking out the next day so the "upgrade really didnt matter. For the price that this old hotel charges, along with the ridiculos charge for parking, the awful service, and poor condition on the room I WOULD NOT RECOMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, staff”
Reviews.Author: Bay_Area_traveler_1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over many years - each has been very good. Keep in mind there are many levels of rooms - we usually try to stay in the 'jr. suites' but have stayed in the smaller, regular rooms also, as well as in one of the huge multi-room ones on the marina (one time the travel agent had mis-booked us, Humphreys saw that we were frequent guests and immediately put us in a huge suite for our troubles - am sure that was unusual event). You may want to call first to see which area your room is in - near the concert hall, or with limited view (there are some). Only issue is when they have concerts in another part of the facility, which can get a bit loud. The restaurant is fine. We often use the concierge service, which has been very good at getting us into restaurants at the last minute. It is within walking distance of shops and a good number of restaurants, amidst the boat harbor and yacht businesses.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump”
Reviews.Author: ITGeekGrl
Reviews.Content: We came for Comicon and all the hotels we wanted to stay at were, ofcourse, completely booked up. Read some really good reviews on this place and was really excited to try it out. The description said it had a good view of the bay, the hotel was rated high and it seemed like quite a luxurious place. Checking in went smoothly. They had heavenly chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. Then we opened the door to our room. Ewh! It was total motel 6! There wasn't a balcony. I have a clear view of some palm tree leaves, but no bay. It smelled funky and everything was dingy and dark. But, since everything was booked up, we didn't have much of a choice. So, we get back from the convention the first day and open the room door. Out blows a plume of marijuana smoke! So apparently the guests next door decided to hot box it and it all seeped into our room! So much for nonsmoking rooms.. Tried to change rooms. Of course, there were no other rooms available. I can't believe people honeymoon at this place! It's a total dump. Save the money and stay at a motel 6. The room's are the same. Comicon rocked! Humphrey's sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Totall Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: mudman408
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites which looked over the marina. Our suite had a full kitchen, with refrigator, microwave, oven, and coffee pot (with all essentials for coffee or tea). We had a balcony where we could sit outside, have coffee enjoying the veiw and peace and quite. there was no bugs or flies but there were some little ducks in the courtyard. When we did take time to relax in front of the tv, great reception and they have free HBO (for you advid movie watchers). We had double beds which were so comfortable you didn't want t get out of bed (would of loved to take it home). If you want to order room service there is a full menu in the room and at a very reasonable price. the courtyard is just amazing with wonderful folage all around which makes it peaceful. The employees and the concierge were all so helpful and friendly. Being that we were not sure where to visit, they provided a brochure with ideas and directions. We would absolutely recommend Humphrey's Half Moon Inn & Suite to anyone who wants to enjoy a nice coastal getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: barneybear66
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night last week and we can see why people like this place - we did too. Would recommend you bring your ear plugs however as the sound proofing between the rooms is pretty much non-existent and if your neigbours like to talk or keep the TV on late then you will also be getting the benefit! But there is lots to like about the Humphrey's with it's a great location (away from Downtown and very handy for the airport); good facilities; slightly dated but fun tropical look, and easy on-site parking ($10 per night at time of writing). Overall, we were happy with our stay here and would return, especially given the that price on Expedia was pretty reasonable compared to the very expensive alternatives in San Diego at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellabooCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great plcae to stay! The hotel is located right next to the water.We actually sat there and watched the sting rays next to the rocks.My children loved it.The rooms are very clean and quiet.They had a concert going on Saturday night and we could sit out on our patio and listen to it,but once we walked into the room we heard nothing.It was great.Each room has a small patio where you can sit and enjoy the ocean breeze.The patio is covered with lush greenery.I felt like I was in a tropical forest.I would reccomend this place to anyone that is plannng a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's is the Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: After making my reservation I spoke to Dawn at the Hotel and she was extremely accomodating to my needs. From the moment I spoke to Dawn I knew that my stay there would be a great one. We arrived to the hotel at 11am and because our room was vacant ready we were able to check right in. I was traveling with my 10 year daughter. We both loved the pool. For two days we lounged at the pool and ordered food and drinks. Room service always delivered our food with a smile on their face and eager to please. Chris at the Front Desk is hard to beat when it comes to service. He was multi-tasking like you wouldn't believe. When it was my turn to speak to him he admitted that they were short handed and working a bit harder then normal. Although very busy, Chris still went out of his way to show us bikes to choose from when we wanted to take bikes out for a ride. As a hotel employee it's great to see staff that know how to give great service and make it look effortless. There were several other encounters with different staff and all of them were pleasant. The housekeeping staff throughout the property always greated us with a smile and hello. Thanks to all the employees for going the extra mile to please your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurreyHolidayer
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Humphrey's. Very friendly reception staff who upgraded us immediately! Room was big enough for two and two kids, not huge but perfectly OK and clean. Free internet is nice, either wireless in your room or on a computer in reception. We weren't originally going to go to a concert but booked on the day (Tom Jones). The concert space is terrific - quite small and intimate and lovely surroundings. The hotel itself is situated a short walk away from various restaurants and fast food places (Subway, Pizza, chinese) and a small grocery shop. Taxis cost around $15-20 to get to the Zoo or Sea World with plenty waiting to take you back. The major attraction though was the lovely waterside path that ran for a mile alongside the hotel, great for early morning runs! It's great. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, bad shower”
Reviews.Author: all_of_that_one
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a good experience staying at Humphrey's. The hotel was, initially, VERY hard to find. Directions given by the front desk were useless and we kind of lucked into finding the place. Our room overlooked the harbor, which was nice. We were upgraded to an upstairs room with this view. The room was pretty large, and included a small fridge. The pool was great - we used the jacuzzi more than once. The staff was friendly. The only problem - the shower had a leak from the ceiling. It was a bit gross showering while cold water of unknown origin was dripping on you. Didn't want to give up the room, so we just dealt with it. It was the only detraction. Well, that and the price. Pretty expensive and it was a bit of a drive to get to other parts of San Diego. We were happy with the room, but probably could have done better if I had started looking a little earlier for better accomodations. Breakfast was not included and one tip would be to NOT eat at their restaurant. Food was mediocre at best and the buffet had small flies buzzing about. That was not too pleasant to see.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: matthewpink
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights and we were given a newly renovated room probabaly the best room I have ever stayed in. The pool area and grounds are first class. There is a concert venue next door and the day we arrived Tom Jones was playing in the evening we went to see the concert and there are only about 1000 seats so you are close to the stage where ever you sit. You really need a car here there are a few restaurants within walking distance but the beach is about 3 miles away. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust the 800 #”
Reviews.Author: Unhappycamper84
Reviews.Content: Although the grounds and rooms were very nice, I had an unbelievably bad time at your front desk. My wife and I are using debit cards while a identity theft on us is being investigated. My wife called the information number for your hotel and asked if you accepted checks, as she didn't want to travel down with lots of cash. She was told yes. My wife, son, and his friend took the train down while I finished a television pilot that I was shooting that Friday. My wife called me from your desk at 9:00PM to say you don't take checks, unless they are posted 14 days in advance. The clerk explained to me that " The 800 number serves several hotels" and even though I was on my way, and I had cash, I was still 3 hours away. Nothing she could do. Between my wife, son and friend they came up with enough cash to secure the rooms, forgoing dinner until I arrived. The clerk at the desk when I arrived knew nothing. The next morning I checked again and was told I owed $200.00 for the previous night. I paid in advance for that (Sat) night. That night when we returned ours doors wouldn't open> The front desk again said I owed for that night. I paid again, only to be told at check out I owed another $200. I gave the hotel $ 800.00 in cash, my wife gave $200 cash and another $200 off of the debit card. So, the bottom line is I spent $1,200 for rooms that when I made the reservation were around $750. So, shame on me for not getting receipts for my cash, shame on you (and your staff) for ripping me off. I didn't catch this until July 5th when my wife and I compared notes. I currently in Shreveport, LA on another shoot so I can't come down to complain. I work in film and my wife writes for a So. Cal destination magazine. Neither of us will be saying, or writing, anything nice. And all I get when I wrote, from Melissa, is "everyone makes mistakes". Whatever.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: my2starfish
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at HHMI. The staff is super friendly, helpful and have great attitudes. The rooms are beautiful with well appointed furniture and terrific views. From our room we could hear the concerts at Humphreys Concerts by the Bay. When we didn't want to hear anymore closing the windows cut out all of the sound. The kids loved the pool. The grounds were tropical and while sitting out at the pool with a tropical drink in hand we felt like we were back in Kauai. We love our new find and can't wait to go back in October!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FunInAz6
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Orbitz as a package deal flight and hotel. When We arrived at the hotel the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the lady behind the counter even upgraded our room to a balcony view over the concert stage, during a concert. Parking was pretty tight the night of the concert but the parking staff was kind enough to cone off our parking spot when we left to do some sight seeing or shopping. It was noisy in the room the night of the concert but it was nice to see the show from the room, and they were finished shortly after 10pm so we did not lose any sleep. The Room was comfortable and well kept I liked the in room air conditioner no noisy outside units. The grounds to the hotel were tropical looking Felt like I was on a hawaiin island somewhere. I was impressed with the hotel in everyway. If you like seafood I would recommend "Point loma seafoods" it is a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Arctic_Daisy
Reviews.Content: Wow! More than we expected. Based on good reviews we decided to stay at Humphrey's Half Moon on Shelter Island - and we were not disappointed. Good value for the money, great staff, location okay - occasional jet noise from the base during the day, noticeable but not annoying. Wonderful area for walking - excellent Pizza place within walking distance (Villa Nova) - probably some of the best food we had in San Diego. If you do not have a car, and do not want to deal with public transit, it will cost you about $20 one way to get to just about any place - Balboa Park, Downtown, Old Town, etc. The room was very clean - lots of closet space good size bathroom. I would not book a partial bay view room, rather book the pool view, because the partial bay view room is way on the other side of the parking lot - - and a very partial view :). The restaurant onsite was fabulous for breakfast, had a great view of the harbor and very healthy meal choices. It was so good we couldn't bring ourselves to eat breakfast any place else. We didn't get to experience any concert but if we had the opportunity would definitely partake in one there - very nice set up.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: dolly00
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel and grounds. Attention to detail is important to the staff. Chief Concierge was the best. Humphrey's Restaurant has good food at a reasonable price for the area. Liked the ability to print boarding passes before leaving. Beautiful location and only 15 minutes away from many tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Well above expectations and great experience”
Reviews.Author: AZ3kids
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute and was a little worried when the reservation came in. This was a great deal though, excellent room that looked like it had just been remodeled. The staff was very helpful and upgraded us right away upon arrival to a suite overlooking the water for first time visit. Our 3 kids loved the room and the feel of the Inn. More like a B and B, you will not be disappointed. We stay in San Diego every year and this was one of our best stays.

Reviews.Title: “very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: imsintramurals
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference around the area. When we got to the hotel, our rooms were not ready for check in because our reservations were not until the next day. Nonetheless, the front desk staff worked diligently to get us a room despite not having a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RochieGirl
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at the hotel was in July for a concert. We booked the room, dinner and concert package. We had a marvelous time! The dinner was outstanding, the restaurant is lovely. The show was great, seats were amazing (third row). Though I don't think there is a bad seat in the venue. What a place to see a show, gorgeous view, perfect weather, intimate. Even the performer was awed by it. We had a beautiful room with a nice view of the bay. It was a wonderfully romantic evening in a wonderfully romantic setting. After the show we went to the Backstage club, listened and danced to some great blues. A perfect evening! We have stayed here a few times as well as many other hotels in San Diego. This is our absolute favorite, a tropical paradise. We are never disappointed. We love it so much we even had our wedding here. I couldn't have asked for a better location or service. Even the reception dinner had magnificent food with that gorgeous view! Our guests were all very impressed, many of whom stayed at the hotel. We stay here as often as possible. It holds a special place in our hearts. It is not inexpensive but I think it is worth it the money to create some special memories. I highly recommend Humphrey's!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: UM54
Reviews.Content: Spend 7 nights at Humphrey's the first wk of Feb Must be their off-season as we felt as tho we had the place to ourselves, which was OK with us. Hotel was fairly easy to get to, clean & quiet; spa was hot, pool was cool, grounds were immaculate. Concert stage was closed. Our 1st time in SD, we were on the go from dawn to dusk so didn't have a chance to sample the restaurant on site or even their room svc. Stayed in a Jr Suite with the bay, linear park and distant city skyline across the street. Bed was great, sleep uninterrupted, shower was hot, linens fresh and housekeeping svc was prompt and efficient. A very few pesky ants roaming the sink and countertop didn't faze us. Humphrey's wasn't cheap and we knew that going in ($279 per night including parking.) For our basic needs however, (sleeping, showering and carry-in suppers) we might consider staying somewhere more economical next time. Then again, I doubt it :-) But for our 1st visit, I'm glad we chose Humphrey's and wouldn't hesitate to return there or recommend it to our friends. The 'Where' magazine with maps in the room was most helpful. We look for those everywhere we go. And if you visit SD and don't have breakfast at Kono's on the ocean end of Garnett Ave in Pacific Bch at least once, then there's just no hope for you. MKD Jackson MO

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rate”
Reviews.Author: gemini61777
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel by myself the first night. Although the room was on the first floor with a patio, I felt safe. The parking lot was pretty full and the spots were tiny, so I don't recommend parking a truck or huge SUV. There was a wedding on site, which was gorgeous. There's a few restaurants down the street that were great. The concierage was very nice and made reservations for us with no problem. Location was great and the rate was one of the best in the city for what we received. I would definitely stay at Humphrey's again.

Reviews.Title: “What 'Waterview'???!”
Reviews.Author: ducati100ds
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Bay Club next door and knew the Half Moon through it's excellent Sunday Brunch, great pool etc so wanted to take the family for a treat. Moral - if you find a great hotel - stick with it. The good bits - the grounds are spectacular and even with poor weather the kids had a great time in the pool which was warm. The music bar is great - I saw two excellent bands - very reasonable cover charge. However - the room was described as a Waterview which it would have been if there had not been a 50ft high tent right outside - frankly it was like being on an industrial park. The room was dingy and tired and not sparkling clean, and I object to being hit with a 10dollar/night charge for a very ancient and uncomfortable roll away when one was requested at booking, but not priced in [and it was not in the room when we arrived]. We were charged parking too - I don't understand this with US hotels - you get the shuttle for free [which costs them] but if you drive yourself you pay? No help with bags offered - and you have to climb up steps. The main restaurant was closed and Sunday Brunch was cancelled - one of our main reasons for going. Why is this annoying - because there's nothing on the website about these closures BUT we did get e-mails from the hotel offering tickets to San Diego attractions before we started our trip. If we had known about the tent and the restaurant problems before hand, we would have probably saved our visit to another time, as it is - we feel a bit 'cheated' and will now revert back to to the Bay Club Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Member057
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after reading the reviews. We were going after the concert season, so noise wouldn't be a problem. We booked a "garden/pool view suite" to avoid the reviews of problems with "traditional rooms". Perhaps because we are from Las Vegas, we have different ideas as to what makes a hotel, "wonderful, amazing, etc." Our suite was a good size and clean. It was partially renovated. The bath had a beautiful counter, new sinks and faucets. The bathtub was old and patched. The kitchen had a new laminate floor that did not match the old cabinets. The carpet was old and stained. The sofa was so worn, we turned over the cushions so we could sit and not sink so low that the back of our legs were pressed against the outer frame. We had no idea that all the suites are on the second floor and there are no elevators. No one offered to help with our bags after they told us about this, so we did it ourselves. On check-out, the call to the bell desk went unanswered. The woman at the desk asked if we needed help as I was handing her the room keys. The pool and hot tub area were nicely landscaped and looked inviting. We did not try them as we didn't want to climb up and down the stairs. We used room service once. The food was very good and no more expensive than room service at other hotels. I know that San Diego prices are high. We come here several times a year. However, if we had not found a good deal on [--], which the hotel matched, I would have been more than disapppointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: mistymendocino
Reviews.Content: My husband's and my first night at Humphrey's on 11/5/2007 before our Carnival Cruise was for One Enchanted Evening. It was really good and we cancelled an excellent upgrade opportunity for the Manchester Grand Hyatt and booked another One Enchanted Evening for 11/14/2007. Our second stay, we were robbed by the hotel. Both of us went in the lobby on 11/5 and hotel personnel said we had to book through the internet or 800 phone number. We did so through the 800 number. Phone agent asked if it was for the same package? My husband answered yes and confirmed $179.00 for the same package with the phone agent at the 800 number. We arrived on 11/14 and were given a standard poolview room with no extras. We went to the lobby to find out if there had been a mistake. When my husband went to the lobby and he asked about this, the manager said the package could not be booked through the 800 number but by the desk or the internet. We have the flyer and this is not true, you can book it through the 800 number. We don't know why he told us this. The hotel agent also said this package just wasn't available to us, were billed the same price as the package for a standard pool-view room. The manager came out and backed up hotel agent's statements. Furthermore, just by seeing the price and our previous stay, the staff should have known the $179.00 was for the package because rack rates for Humphrey's was $169.00. In addition, a conscientious staff would have graciously corrected the problem and made sure customers were happy. The room was dingy and dirty and the toilet had a ring around the edges of God only knows what. There was NO champagne, no fruit, no basket and no breakfast the next morning. This was definitely NOT an enchanted evening. This was the last day of a romantic vacation and neither of us wanted to fight with hotel personnel on our last day of our holiday. We were going to recommend Humphrey's to our friends but now we will warn them about the bait and switch that goes on there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the entire experience”
Reviews.Author: docpwells
Reviews.Content: We had a truly relaxing stay. The pool was great and the staff was most helpful. We had a slight problem during checkin and the Staff gave us comps for breakfasts (2). We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's was more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Fredkins713
Reviews.Content: I recently had a 2 night stay at Humphrey's on Shelter Island in San Diego. I was nervous because of some of the reviews I have read, and was pleasantly surprised by how beautiful this place is. There are some wonderful views all around the grounds of this hotel. I stayed in a mini-suite, which was much more comfortable with the additional space. I had a waterfront view, although the water was a little furthur away than I would have liked. The sunrise was breathtaking, (kind of confusing, because being from the east coast, I know the sun sets in the west, but this is a peninsula, so I was facing east). The bed is comfortable, the room was clean, and the surrounding areas seem safe, very clean and very picturesque. I had breakfast 2 times at the hotel, and it was wonderful. The pool area is so gorgeous. There is nothing overgrown about the foliage, as I have read. There are beautiful palm trees, tropical plants and hibiscus flowers everywhere, but they are well groomed, and beautiful. I would come back to this place in a second. The only problem I really had was with the parking. They could use a larger parking area, as it is very tight and there were not a lot of available parking spaces when I visited. Other than that, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again.”
Reviews.Author: auntie1
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before booking, and I am happy we chose Humphrey's. We stayed in a garden/ pool king on the 2nd floor. The room was comfortable, the staff were accommodating, and the location is central. I much prefer this type of set up where the door opens up to the outside, rather than to a hallway. Reminded me of a hotel we stayed at in Maui. Had dinner at Fiddler's Green - great restaurant with delicious prime rib and a nice atmosphere. Back at the hotel, there was loud music going on but not too late - till maybe 1130pm? If you plan to go to bed early, you might want to think about a different location. I rarely go to bed before midnight anyway, so not a problem for me. There was also a military plane that broke the sound barrier and scared the living daylights out of me as I was laying in bed watching tv. Other than that, no complaints. Overall, great experience. Yay Humphrey's.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we thought....”
Reviews.Author: cworth2288
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel and knew it was on the marina...and the way the website looked and description read, it sounded like it was close to the beach- like walking distance. Not so much. We did drive there and it was not too far- maybe 15 minutes? The hotel has a nice tropical feel with lush gardens all over and green grass. The pool was okay, and it had a bar next to the Jacuzzi, but it closed at 9pm. What I did not like was that the room smelled like mold. I guess being located on the water it is hard to get out the dampness. The door opened to our own patio, only semi-private, for two reasons....we had to share it with the local resident ducks who begged for food and the vegetation did not cover the entire perimeter. If you stay on Shelter Island, the sidewalks roll up at 10, leaving us to drive to forage for food. (Or a nearby restaurant that was open.) We had to venture off the island to find some nightlife as well. Gas lamp quarter is very pretty, but was teeming with college students as it was Labor Day weekend. Overall, I would not be back to this location, as secluded and tropical as it is- unless I docked my own boat to it.

Reviews.Title: “Tub troubles . . . .”
Reviews.Author: SouthPasTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a night of rest after a day at the SD Zoo. Only our daughter took a shower that night . . . . when we woke in the morning we noticed the tub had never drained. Long story short -- at one point we had had five different plumbers in and out of our room who finally gave up (they told us they were calling Roter Rooter). To the hotel's credit (and since we were eager to check out so we could return to the Zoo), the hotel sent someone up from the front desk with a key to a room two doors down, so we could use the facilities before leaving. After I requested a reduction in the one-night rate, they took 25 percent off, and comped our lounge charge ($40) from the afternoon before. On the plus side: The rooms are large and the grounds and pool are lovely. Although the lounge was packed with pre-concert goers, the service was friendly and prompt. Getting to hear Steve Tyrell rehearse for the concert was a nice experience. On the still more negative side: We made a reservation at the hotel restaurant for 8:45, when we were told they would have room since the pre-concert crowd had cleared out. We weren't seated until sometime after 9 (since there were only 3 other parties in the restaurant, which is fairly large, didn't quite understand this). Parties were led in one-bay-one to an empty restaurant. There was only one server working, in addition to the busboys. Service was very, very slow. Food was okay but overpriced. The facilities at the hotel really seem to need an upgrade (when we went to use the other bathroom, the shower control broke off in my husband's hand).

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: DianeAndy
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at Humphrey's for 3 nights at the end of September. We booked a Bay View Room as the photographs on the hotel website looked fabulous & the reviews were OK. Our first impression of the room was that it smelled musty & was a little gloomy. Although we could see the bay, the room did overlook the car park & on concert nights noise was a problem. However, the musty smell became less noticeable during our stay & apart from that it was a comfortable & clean room. The other negative aspect of the hotel was that concerts take place nearly every night & although the concert itself didn't affect us the increased traffic did & the bar & restaurant were off limits to hotel guests until 8.30 pm. To summarise, our stay at Humphrey's was OK but we felt that the concert goers were the hotel's main priority & other hotels in San Diego may have been cheaper with a better location.

Reviews.Title: “what we expected”
Reviews.Author: lukemarshall
Reviews.Content: must say that our stay at humphrey's was exactly what we expected after reading the reviews on here. yes the room was a liitle musty, but apart from that i haven't got any gripes at all. room was clean, staff were helpful, grounds of hotel are lovely. the concerts that are held there don't really cause any problems as they finish by around 10pm, i actually think it is a bit of a bonus to have them held there as you don't normally get to hear live music of that quality in your hotel. also must say that the bands we saw at the hotel bar were also very good and as you get to see them for free if staying at the hotel and made a good end to most evenings. overall thought humphreys was a nice play to stay, making a change from the normal run of the mill hotels you usually stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Musty Room and Concert Noise at the Humphrey”
Reviews.Author: Smokeyham
Reviews.Content: Quick Summary Be sure you know what type of room you are getting because a number of the rooms certainly don’t live up to the description on the front pages of the hotel’s website. Also, be aware of the noise issues at this hotel because of the concert venue on the hotel grounds, and the number of large groups which reserve this venue. Full Review Humphreys Half Moon Inn is on Shelter Island, San Diego. The hotel is situated with a boat works, where yachts and other small boats are housed and maintained on one side, and a marina on the other. After the many positive reviews on this website I had high expectations, but my early impressions were disappointing. The website seems to indicate that your room will either be a marina/bay or a garden view. The hotel website includes a description of the non-Bay view rooms as follows: “First floor rooms offer direct access to our private pool and tropical gardens through furnished patios.” Unfortunately, it turned out that our rooms were what are labeled “traditional” rooms by the hotel, which means they do not look out on the garden or the bay, but on to the parking lot. These rooms are not mentioned till you dig further into the website. Quite frankly, for the price the room I stayed in was not good value. The advertised price per night for the room was $189. Because of a concert being held on the property on the first night, the actual room rate was $209. Two subsequent nights were at a rate of $139, which was a rate negotiated for our group (posted rate was $189). The room décor was quite honestly upper-end motel quality (perhaps equivalent to a Best Western or La Quinta). My room was dark, and had a very musty smell to it, ironic in light of a sign in the room which said “Fresh” and warned of a $250 charge for smoking in the room. There are some features of the rooms which bring up the quality. Gilchrist and Soames toiletries in the bathroom are nice, and the free wireless internet access is appreciated by those with laptops. There is also an in-room safe, a self-service coffee maker, and an ironing board and iron. Other room amenities include: laundry service, and room-service (see below for a review of the service). The rooms are air conditioned (welcome, even in the much-vaunted “mild” climate of San Diego), and the air conditioner in my room was quite and effective. Other rooms I looked at were more light and airy, and had more room; though the décor was similar. Higher rate rooms also have robes provided. Housekeeping The room was generally well cleaned, but on two nights I had to go to the front desk to ask for a form to hang on my front door to pre-order breakfast. There was a form provided to submit for laundry to be done, but no bag provided to put the laundry in. On a strange note, housekeeping would try to clean the room at 8:00 AM. If you order the breakfast from room service, then you’ll need to put out the privacy sign after breakfast to avoid having housekeeping interrupt you after your breakfast! Other Amenities The hotel does offer a free shuttle service from the airport, and the service was very quick. The check-in staff was polite and efficient and professionally dealt with a set of packages which were delivered to the hotel prior to my arrival. The pool area and tropical grounds are nicely kept. Room Service On the night of arrival I attempted to order room service at 6:30 PM, but was warned that it would be at least an hour. I went and had a drink at the pool, and met friends and then re-tried to order at 8:30 PM, at which point the wait was a reasonable 25 minutes. Dinner (Filet Mignon + a Crème Brulee) was $56 (no alcohol). The service was prompt and courteous. I used room service for breakfast for two mornings, and found the breakfast to satisfactory, though the hotel did get my cooked egg order wrong on one morning. A nice touch was that room service calls you about five minutes before they are going to deliver the breakfast, so you can be awake and decent when they arrive! Noise Issues Do be aware that there are concerts (both public and private) held regularly on the hotel grounds, so definitely check the concert dates on the hotel website if you are not interested in hearing the music. However, private group using the concert area will not be shown on the website. Concerts also impact the availability of the fitness room and other facilities. The night I arrived there was a public concert taking place, and I could hear the music throughout the grounds, but did not hear it in my room (an advantage of being at far end of the property and facing the parking lot, away from the concert area). At the close of the concert there was a bit of noise in the parking lot from people talking, starting cars, returning to their rooms, etc. but not bad. Even on nights when a public concert is not advertised, the hotel may be hosting a private event, which includes a band or DJ using the concert area. The noise will impact the surrounding rooms, and some hotel facilities will not be available. From other posts I understand that this is also a popular venue for weddings, and wedding parties. If you decide to book a nicer room, say overlooking the Bay, you should enquire as to whether there are public or private concerts scheduled and/or wedding or other groups. You might try for a room in the K,L or M buildings to minimize the noise issues, and maximize your privacy. Overall Frankly, I would not recommend this hotel because of the noise issues with the concerts, and other large private parties which rent the facilities. If you are with a group, and are looking for a conference hotel, then this may be a good facility, but be sure to warn your attendees that the rooms do vary in quality. A different hotel, The Dana at Mission Point, is owned by the same owners and might be a better bet for people not traveling as a part of a group. We did a kayak tour from that hotel, and it seemed like a nicer facility. However, do read the reviews about that hotel on this website for information about the old buildings v. the new buildings. If you want to try this hotel, then it is probably worth spending the money to get a room which looks out over the bay. I would especially avoid the “traditional” rooms, which are poor value. Even the “garden view rooms” don’t have much appeal (they’re not very private). A bay view room, at the far end of the property from the concert area and the pool is probably your best bet, though these are likely the most expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise on the Marina”
Reviews.Author: CaptinEO7
Reviews.Content: After spending a long time researching the ideal place to stay for a week in San Diego & having spent time in the city before some time ago we finally settled on Humphreys & we were so glad we made that decision. We drove down after staying a few nights at the Disneyland Hotel and found the hotel relatively easily (it's only a 5 minute drive from the airport). The location is a pleasant 10/15 minute drive along the bay to Downtown, less to Sea World & slightly more to the Zoo (all of which you have to do whilst in the city). The city itself does look much further away when you look across the bay but don't let this deceive you, as long as you have a car it's lovely to be a very short drive away but feel like you're a million miles from the city. The hotel is situated a minute or two off the "mainland" by a narrow stretch of land literally the width of a road lined with a number of boating stores & nautical restaurants. The hotel itself consists of a variety of building styles, most of which surround the pool & garden area. The main entrance is an impressive,large Polynesian-style wooden arch, the the theme of which continues through the cool lobby and throughout the hotel. The public areas are all beautifully landscaped with a great pool & hot tub surrounded by lush foliage. To the one side of the hotel lies a superb view of the immediate marina-side although the suites that look out over this are substantially more expensive than throughout the rest of the property. Our room was a Garden-View style which opened up directly onto the pool area although one of the only negatives about the hotel was that the location of ours(and most of the rooms of this type) were set slightly below ground level and were subsequently very dark. We preferred this option however to a room which faced the entrance-side of the hotel which opened onto the parking-lot and did look like upmarket motel rooms from the exterior. Our room was very tastefully decorated with two large beds and a large bathroom with two wash-hand basins. Even though the room was dark until all the lamps were switched on we particularly liked the ceiling with natural wooden beams painted white. We never tried the restaurant which is apparently highly rated and did look very, very nice but the one thing we didn't utilise which we would have loved to was the Open-Air Concert Venue. When checking in you are given a timetable of events and throughout the Summer there were a whole host of artists including George Benson, Huey Lewis & The News, The Indigo Girls, Steve Winwood, Boyz 2 Men & Steve Winwood. We would have loved to have watched a concert whilst staying at the property but whilst we were there nobody was to our fancy. It must be THE coolest venue to watch a gig. To one side the tropical feel of the hotel, to the other the open marina and only steps from our room. Often we ate in a local restaurant and whilst walking back to the hotel we were walking past hundreds of people who were vacating the premises - it was very laid back however and just overall very cool. There are several restaurants & bars you can walk to from Humphreys & we particularly enjoyed Miguels (Mexican) & Fiddler's Green (casual bar & restaurant upstairs). Both establishments are 5/10 minute walk from the hotel & whilst they both offered vastly different experiences both places perfectly matched our needs of great food, beer & wine in relaxed but very unique atmospheres. Overall we absolutely loved our stay at Humphreys - we paid approx £80 per night & for that we got a great location, beautifully kept grounds & pool & although slightly on the dark side, very nice rooms. We would definitely stay here on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Unique”
Reviews.Author: PamelaDahhling
Reviews.Content: After doing lots of research on hotels, for our Labor Day weekend in San Diego, I chose Humphrey's. Not knowing much about Shelter Island, and having a picky husband, I really hoped our stay would be worth the $$. I reserved a Marina View Suite...and didn't regret the decision at all! As you see from photos, this hotel has a very tropical setting. The pool is surrounded by palms and lush plant life; parrots and koi fish add ambiance, and the casual setting make this a relaxing place. Gorgeous! The staff seem decent; not overly friendly, not overly helpful. Definitely pleasant and relaxed. Our room did indeed look over the Marina. We had two huge rooms and a full kitchen (no dishwasher). The room slept up to six people. A beautiful granite/marble bathroom. A triangular patio to enjoy the view. The recent updates the hotel made to these rooms makes it easy to overlook the old sofa bed, old kitchen cabinets, and mildew in one corner of the tub. The beds were very soft, comfortable. Air conditioning worked great (and we needed it!) and there was a fan too. Overall, great room. My picky husband was pleased! We were just two staircases over from Humphrey's concert hall and were pleased to listen to the Blues playing, while we sat on our patio. Concerts are usually over by 10 ish. The frequent entertainment is what makes the hotel unique. Friends of ours stayed in a guest room (room 105), and the patio was directly over the audience for the concert. What a fantastic spot to watch the concert from! IF YOU HAVE SMALL KIDS AND WANT THEM TO GO TO SLEEP EARLY, MAKE SURE YOUR ROOM IS ON THE OPPOSITE END OF THE PROPERTY. The staff will not warn you ahead of time unless you ask in advance! The guest room was beautiful too, by the way. The restaurant serves very good food and the Sunday brunch is fabulous...make a reservation! If you want to eat poolside, however, order well in advance...it takes forever to get the food. We even ordered some cocktails, poolside on Labor Day - the pool bar wasn't open yet and it took the restaurant bar over 30 minutes to bring four drinks. The pool temp was perfect, lounge chairs seemed new, towels ample. We even played croquet and we saw several people enjoying ping pong. Shelter Island is busy, but not overly. It's fairly convenient to the airport, Old Town, and Mission Bay. If you wish to avoid any windy conditions, the marina side of this hotel is great...while we were there, there was hardly any breeze! But the weather was unusually hot that Labor Day Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TVLCleveland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nites and were absolutely pleased with every aspect. The room was great, with a patio so even though we were in a non smoking room, you could smoke right outside on the patio. Room had a fridge which worked out perfect. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is quite relaxing. The staff was very helpful and everyone went out of there way to help. They offer a free airport shuttle. The concerts they offer during the summer, cannot be beat, and if you do not want to pay the price of admission, then just sit by the pool and enjoy the sounds. Super hotel and will stay again without question.

Reviews.Title: “The whole family loves Humphreys!”
Reviews.Author: RivetGang
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Humphrey's 3 times when I have travel to San Diego for a conference. I have always been with the family in tow, and have always had a great experience. I choose based on other reviews here, and was at first worried about some of the complaints that other reviewers brought up. My worries were unfounded, it is a great place to stay. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham,England
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Splendid location overlooking Coronado island from one side and the marina from the other. Great views of downtown San Diego from across the road. Large, comfortable rooms with plenty of space. Attractive swimming pool and gardens. Previous reviews left me concerned about the friendliness of staff but we thought they were great. Our only regret was not asking the Concierge for advice on eating places sooner. She supplied us with a map and details of local restaurants, with plenty within walking distance. Miguel's great for a low price, fun meal. Pizza Nova (a short drive away) serves excellent pizza and pasta. We would definitely stay again. The Sunday Brunch at the hotel is definitely worth the money - tremendous choice of well prepared food in a gorgeous setting with live music thrown in. Concerts were an additional excitement to the holiday rather than a nightmare as described by some.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tr0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while on business. This hotel is great. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly and the pool area is fantastic. Restaurant while pricey does have great tasting food. They have concerts just about every night during the summer, but if you go in your room and shut the door, you cannot even hear it, or you can sit out on your little patio that every room has, or by the pool and enjoy a free concert. The only real negative I have is that they charge $8 a day for parking. Shelter Island is beautiful, and a very safe area. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: magandako
Reviews.Content: My wife recently had surgery so I decided to surprise her & the kids for a quick trip to San Diego. I went to your website first to check on your different recommendations for places to stay in San Diego. Humfreys had a lot of good positive reviews so I got sold to it! I checked on the hotel's website the last minute for a quick look & they offered a last minute deal for a Bay View Room for $159/nite. I immediately booked it & left the next day. We arrived @ the resort @11am & we were surprised that we have a room rightaway. Not only that, the lady who checked us in who was the Supervisor upgraded us for a Marina View Suite upon learning of my wife's condition. (I've heard that this runs about $300+/nite). She also gave us breakfast coupons.We checked in the room & it has killer views of the Marina. The room is very clean & decent. My kids loved the ducks that sits & waits by the door facing the marina. The hotel's lawn was well maintained & the flowers are beautiful! Their pool was amazing as well! They had a concert on going that nite & it was relaxing listening to it while we were @ the pool until 11pm. Of course, it was heated. My kids had a blast. Everybody in the hotel was extremely nice. WE WILL DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's- A Great Way To Experience San Diego”
Reviews.Author: genuajg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from 5 nights at Humphrey's for our Honeymoon. We first stayed at the Loews Coronado and were honestly a bit skeptical when we first got to Humphrey's- and the mixed reviews on this site didn't help. However we were pleasantly surprised. The location of this resort is perfect- sorrounded by the bay on one side (actually across a small road), and the marina on the other. Absolutely no odor, bugs, or birds from the marina which was surprising. We stayed in a junior suite overlooking the concert area- at a rate of 279 per night booked on the hotel's website. Furnishings in the room are a bit dated and the lighting is not the greatest- though overall it was very clean and comfortable, though they haven't picked up on the newer hotels bedding method of no bedspread. Word of warning- the girl at the front desk told us that if you ask for a room overlooking the concerts you will definitely not get it.
