If you are in the San Diego area and can get a good deal on a room here, it's definately worth it, Shelter Island was the perfect place to stay and was convenient to the San Diego Zoo, SeaWorld and downtown as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: subcycle
Reviews.Content: My husband & I met another couple at the hotel for a 4 night stay. We had a gift certificate for a Casablanca package and they had the same. We were both upgraded to rooms with a view of the concert venue which was wonderful and we didn't even have to ask! We were there for one of the concerts so this was an unexpected surprise. Our friends had some issues that were taken care of by the hotel quickly. Room service was very good on a busy concert night. The hotel is close to everything we wanted to do and to the airport. We all enjoyed our time very much and can't wait to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Half Moon Inn is my new favorite!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was just in town for the San Diego Music Awards and this was my first visit**It was so beautiful....the employees were friendly...the grounds were gorgeous and its right near the water!! And if you can be there to catch a concert ...even better! This was a trip I soon won't forget! I had a blast and by the way, I was traveling alone and felt very safe** You all rock Humphreys Half Moon Inn And a special shout out to my friend who helped me back to my room that night! Room 155...... Thanks! TAMI stewart

Reviews.Title: “tropical paradise, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 1traveljunkie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds were very well maintained, very tropical....a slice of Hawaii in San Diego. The front desk staff were great, very friendly. Even though there was a bit of a wait to check in (20 mins.) and a few impatient people in line were giving the desk staff a hard time about it, they maintained a professional, friendly attitude. But what do you expect when 30 people all show up at the same time to check in? Relax....you're on vacation! They have a large fish tank in the lobby with colorful tropical fish that was enjoyable to watch while we waited to check in. The rooms were spacious and clean, very comfy beds. The view of the lush garden was relaxing, pool area had a great atmosphere, pool bar, table tennis, mood lighting at night. Just perfect! There is also a putting green and croquet area and bicycles available to tool around the waterfront...if you have kids there is a park down the street right on the bay. We also loved the viewing decks on the marina side, very peaceful. Food was excellent in the restaurant (I recommend the macadamia nut crusted halibut, YUM!) and the live music in the lounge was great...we didn't have to go off property to have a night out. Tip: no cover charge for hotel guests so show your room key to the door guy. There was a concert during our stay, which we were made aware of when we made the reservation. Not an inconvenience at all and was over by 10:30. We enjoyed food and drinks around the pool and were entertained by the Doobie Brothers! Where else can you enjoy such a unique experience? Overall this was one of the most relaxing yet lively vacations I have ever had and will return to Humphrey's everytime I go to San Diego and will recommend it to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: bethrad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property - it's visually appealing from the minute you drive up. I was frustrated at check-in, because while there seemed to be a few employees there, only one person was checking people in. It seems that they really like to take a lot of time with people when they check in (not your standard hand them your credit card and they hand you your room key kind of transaction. It's nice that they want to spend time with each person, but I waited about 20 minutes before it was my turn. I was very satisfied with my room - I thought it was modern and up-to-date, and nicely furnished. I had a view of the swimming pool area. The bathroom was nice, and had a nice array of shower/bath products. One thing I noticed was that if I was laying on the bed I could see a large gap between the entry door and the ground - I could see the ground outside. That creeped me out because who knows what could be crawling through there, but I didn't mention it to the hotel. A friend of mine was also staying at the property while I was there, and he was in the building that faces the stage in the concert area. His room didn't seem as nice as mine, but I can't really explain why I felt that way (seemed about the same size - different layout). His balcony was used by the sound crew during the concert, but no big deal because we weren't in the room at that time anyway. The service at the lounge on property was excellent - we had a specific request and they went out of their way to fulfill it, which we thought was really above and beyond standard hotel lounge service. We were very impressed. Overall, I really liked this property. It's beautifully landscaped and unique -doesn't feel like a regular hotel. I thought the service at checkin and checkout was slow, but other than that I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, Great atmoshpere”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphrey's overnight with a concert package. We had seen many concerts in years past, but this was the first time we decided to stay at the hotel. You definitely get the best seats in the house! We had booked two premium room packages as our friends from LA were joining us. We arrived early and luck was on our side, one of the rooms was ready, so we had a place to relax and wait for our guests. We were given a great junior suite with a view of the harbor and downtown San Diego. The layout was a little strange with the bed right by the door, but having the bar area and the living room and patio was great. Bed was nice a firm, which my husband loved, a little hard for me. Things were a little worn, but I was expecting worse from some of the reviews. Everything was really clean though. We had dinner in the restaurant. Food is good, but as we do the dinner/concert packages 3-4 times each summer, I wish the menu changed a little more often. Quality was good though and the service was awesome. Nice view too. We are going back for another concert in a couple weeks, booked the premium view suite package to get front row seats. I hope it is again, better than we expected and hoped for. Staff was very helpful and we loved the friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighs the bad”
Reviews.Author: holidaynut!
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from 23rd Aug to 28th August and prebooked with Virgin before we left the UK. It should be noted that the rooms allocated to Virgin guests are the standard non view rooms which was fine by us as it would have cost soooo much more for a view room. Also, compared to what the hotel was charging for rooms the Virgin price was a bargain. The hotel looks wonderful. The grounds are as everyone says, beautiful, although the rooms are basic. The room lighting was a little depressing and the bed linens and towels were rather old and you can hear the toilet flush and shower from the room above as if it is in your own room! However, we quite happily put up with these issues as the hotel does have such a nice, pleasant feel to it. The pool areas atmosphere changed on a daily basis. The day we arrived we got the impression it was a couples resort, everything silent with the odd couple lounging in the sun. However, it wasn't always like that. The hotel hosts weddings and on one of the days the guests were enjoying the pool for a few hours before the service. The pool was packed, lots of drinking,laughing, joking, and American football being played in the pool. We didn't have a problem with this at all. It was a good atmosphere. There is a table tennis by the pool also which the kids loved. By the way, the wedding was prepared beautifully and everything was arranged to look perfect, so if you are looking to have your wedding there I feel it would be an excellent choice. With regards to food, although we didn't eat in the hotel restraunt, we had a pizza at the poolside and we had to wait a very long time to receive it. It wasn't that good either. Although there were a couple of issues they would not stop us from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Black Queen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lovely. Large clean rooms and very friendly staff. Not much to do around the area at nights unless you are prepared to drive. Would recommend the Red Sails restaurant and the Fiddlers. Very nice and not too expensive. Also Mexican and Italian restaurants which were very reasonable. There is also a seafood reasaurant and a Japanese restaurant in the immediate area but we didn't try them. The hotel restaurant was very expensive (okay for a special occasion but not to eat in every night). Hotel bar okay if you like jazz as they have live music most nights but there is a cover charge of 4dollars. Pool bar closes at 7 every night. The pool area is very nice and there is not a fight for beds!! There are lots of concerts in the summer, we didn't go to one but heard the afternoon practices. Quite loud but not a problem to us. Concerts on the evening were over by 10.30 so no disturbances. We also saw a wedding (right outside our room) That was a little embarrasing as we wanted to sit on outside with our evening drinks but felt as though we were intruding. But it was all over in 3/4 hour so not a great problem, just a minor inconvenience. This hotel is a great base for sightseeing in San Diego but not really suitable for children as there is not much for them to do apart from the pool and a table tennis table.

Reviews.Title: “Decent/But not worth $200 a night.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Humphreys (accross from Bali Hai in Point Loma) for three nights after staying at the Omni. The pool and garden area is very, very nice. The bar in the pool area is well stocked and the bartenders are very friendly. The location is very nice (point loma). You are near the bay-- within 1 block and can walk down the bay. Also a fishing pier is about 2 blocks away. Room service is nice and not that expensive. The hotel as a whole is about a 2.5 star hotel. The pool (with a large spa) is a 4 out of 5. So in summary: Pro's-- Nice pool, spa, and garden. Relatively inexpensive food (room service)-- good location (but not on the bay) - Nice staff, free coffee (in the lobby), near Bali Hai (if you are attending a wedding-which I was) Cons- The rooms are old and need to be updated, bad lighting in rooms, furniture and rugs (furnishings) are vey old, Concerts-- they have very loud concerts until 10:30 pm several nights a week, price-- not worth over $125 or $150 a night-- I paid 199 with partial view of the pool and garden Overall-- Worth it if you pay under $150 or under $125 a night Not worth it if you are paying 200 plus

Reviews.Title: “Very picturesque”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 10 days at the beginning of august 2005 and had a really good time. When we first arrived after a long flight from england and a 2 hour car trip down to San Diego from L.A airport we were very pleased to find that we had been upgraded to a ground level garden view room from our basic room for no extra cost. The room was pretty large with 2 double beds and a big bathroom, everything was very clean and well kept. As we were so tired and it was about 9pm we did the minimum of unpacking and went straight to bed so that we would be refreshed ready for our first day of the holiday, this was when we noticed that the toilet in our room seemed to be automatically trying to flush itsself every two minutes. We decided to endure it overnight and when we informed the hotel reception the next morning they were very helpful and apologetic and got a maintenance guy to fix it while we went out for the day. For the rest of our stay we had no other problems, the only other gripe was that the noise from rooms above us was audible and when the room directly above us used their water the pipes were quite noisy. This didnt bother us too much as we were out almost all day every day and from morning to late night. We also didnt hear much aircraft noise considering the nearness to the airport. The grounds of the hotel are of a high standard and the pool area is very lush and green. We ate at the hotel restaurant each morning for breakfast which provides a great view over shelter island marina. The food was great and reasonably priced and the service was almost always excellent. The location of the hotel on shelter island gives you some great views across the bay to San Diego and Coronado naval base. Getting down into San Diego was easy for us as we had a hire car for the duration of our stay and it was only a 15 minute drive away. Also there were a variety of restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel if you didnt feel like driving down to the gas lamp district. I would stay in this hotel again if i came to San Diego as for a 3 star i thought it was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After paying a hefty amount for Humphreys half moon inn, I am sorry to say that I was completely underwhelmed by my time there, and felt I had wasted a lot of money. The room that i stayed in was small and dark and slightly depressing, I was told that I had been upgraded, from what, I shudder to think, it was clean enough, but again, I expected more for the money. The pool was small for the size of the complex, and I felt as though I had arrived at Butlins when i tried to get a lounger there, this was no sedate hideaway retreat, this was Butlins on acid, screaming kids and kevin the teenager. If, like me you were expecting a relaxing hideaway for a few days forget it, go there if you have kids, lots of money and don't get claustraphobia.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: pvmkmyer
Reviews.Content: We went to Humphreys as part of a concert package and booked 2 nights. Loved the concert and the restaurant, but were disappointed with the hotel. We had 2 garden view rooms, one for our daughters and one for my wife and me. We were shown 3 rooms to choose from. They were the same except for location , so we chose the one closer to the entrance. Our room and our daughter's room, as well as the one we didn't choose, were dark. Even though there was a sliding door to a patio, it was still dark with the drapes open and all the lights on. The closet doors kept coming off their track, and the sink stopper didn't work. The rooms really need to be updated top to bottom. It was clean. Aside from the woman at the front desk, who was very nice, the service was way below par. We waited 1 1/2 hours for our breakfast from room service. They comp'd the meal, but still -- 90 minutes? The room service dishes were still on the ground outside our door when we checked out 24 hours later. My key card had to be re-programmed, which isn't a big deal. But when I went to the front desk the 20-something clerk handed me back the card and said "Here you go, buddy." Buddy? I must be twice his age. I don't think I'm particularly stuck up, but call me by name or use "Sir" to your paying guests. There is no bell service, or if there is, none was offered. We had to schlep our bags at check-in and check-out. There's a desk in the front lobby labeled "bell desk" but I never saw anyone at it. It just had brochures on top. The place has beautiful grounds and I enjoyed the pool very much. The bed was comfortable. The bay location is very nice. These complaints (aside from the room service) are not huge gripes, but they add up. If I were paying $100 a night I wouldn't care, but at $200 a night per room I think Humphreys needs to get on board with their service, and should certainly be offering bell service for those prices. As I said to the desk clerk on checkout, they are charging 4 star prices for what is at most a 3 star hotel. There are plenty of other choices in San Diego where I can take my business.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Come Here- you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a LONG time searching for a suitable hotel to stay in San Diego to suit the requirements of a family which included a 19year old boy and a 17 year old girl. we wanted somewhere that would accomodate 2 beds and a roll away as the boy and girl did'nt want to share. After reading many reviews from trip advisor members we plumped for humphries in Shelter Island. We stayed in a view suite which just could not have been better suited to our needs. I was apprehensive as the rating was 3 star and we normally stay in 4 star min hotels , but members rated this property so highly we decided to chance it. Accomodation was excellent- a separate room with 2 queen beds- more like double uk, and a separate living area with a really good sleeper sofa which my son used. He loved his own separate space at night with his own tv. just off this room was a very adequate kitchen providing free tea/coffee, popcorn and even kitchen roll. we had a beautiful marble bathroom with 2 vanity units and bath/ shower and bath robes and plentiful towels. Outside the bathroom was a dressing area which was great for drying hair make up etc. Only drawback was there was limited drawer space but we managed. My eldest son and his friend who are staying for the summer in San diego visited us often and we could all sit in the living area and never felt crowded. My husband brought his laptop and we had free internet access which allowed everyone to keep in touch. Pool area is just beautiful and so green, tropical and luscious. we always got chairs by the pool and it never appeared crowded. Car parking is free and we always got parked in the car park. We found all the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Shelter Island is beautiful and you can go for lovely walks along the waterfront and large grass area. Not much beach. Drawbacks are under 21,s not allowed in bar after 8 pm as there was live music nightly. So this is a great base for relaxing and sightseeing- 10 mins by car to downtown but a car is essential if staying here. We loved our stay here in case you had'nt realised!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Minybear
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at Humphreys Half Moon Bay. We heard some wonderful reviews of this hotel. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary there. We had booked a bay view room with a king bed. Upon arrival we had gotten upgraded to garden view 1 bedroom unit with 2 double beds. Ok celebrating our 30th anniversary in double beds! Was glad for the upgrade but at the same time upset that we didnt get a view room. We come from the desert and wanted to view water! We didnt like the location also due to we overlooked the pool and the pool had parties in there and they were a little loud. Also we did see a wedding there which we couldnt access some areas of the resort so that also was a little frustrating. Also music from the concert shook our room. Lucky for us the concert was over at 10:30pm. We werent near the concert area but the music shook our room. If you had to go out for the evening and had to come in later on. You couldnt park near your room. Also the parking was too tight. Was afraid to hit the other cars beside you. Also the worst thing that happened to us we got $300 worth of jewelery stolen or missing from our room. We did report the theft but nothing came from it. The good thing is we saved $$ on food due to us having a kitchen. At this time we do not plan on going back to Humphreys. We will try another location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: ginger2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on 7/15/05 with our teens and we LOVED it. Where else can you open your windows and see and hear Clay Walker performing a concert - that was AWESOME. The hotel room was VERY large and the bathroom/vanity area was pretty big too. The bathroom was very pretty and well set up. We had those louvre windows so we could open them at night and let that nice cool San Diego air into the room. The beds were nice and comfy and everything was so clean. We never had a problem finding a parking space - even with the concert because they closed it off to anyone but hotel guests. The area around the hotel was very nice and quiet and it reminded me of Hawaii so much. It was a quick drive to downtown San Diego or even when we went to get a bite to eat on Rosecrans - it is right there. The view from our hotel at night was fabulous - if you went out the front door, you saw a gorgeous view of Downtown San Diego and the harbor and the sailboats. Out the window of our room was the koi pond, the pool and the yacht harbor (along with Clay Walker of course - or whomever is performing at the Concert by the Bay). I would have to say the only negative was being awakened by the two parrots that live right below where our room was...they were squawking up a storm bright and early. So, we went down and talked to them and took pictures of them...they were pretty but I think they were driving each other nuts - must have been married! They were pretty birds and they didn't really make any noise until the morning...if you don't like that, ask for a room closer to the lobby. We were in building D...it runs A,B,C,D, etc with A being closer to the lobby and the pool. I WILL stay here again when I return and would suggest this location to anyone who wants to feel like they are really getting away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: SBMLMK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in other locations in San Diego - downtown and on Mission Bay - so was excited about staying in a new neighborhood. The location of the hotel was wonderful! Right across the street from my room was a walking path along the Bay. It was a beautiful way to start - and end - the day. As I was on Eastern Time waking up on the Pacific Coast, I found myself up at about 3:00 each morning, and felt completely safe walking alone along the Bay until the rest of the city awoke. Yes, the walls are thin and I heard every intimate detail of the lives of the people above me. But, I didn't hear any airplanes, which was a surprise being so close to the airport. I was there for a week for a conference and relied on a shuttle to take me to the Convention Center downtown so I didn't rent a car. Having no car - and no desire to spend $20 each way taking a taxi into the heart of the city - made it difficult finding dinner on nights when there were concerts at Humphrey's. Walking to the "mainland", I was able to find Miguel's, a nice Mexican restaurant (nothing to write home about but good food and interesting decor). Be prepared to walk quite a distance to find food when the hotel's restaurant is reserved for concert-goers. Overall, the room was comfortable, the service was great, and the location was beautiful. On my last night at Humphrey's, I attended a concert on the grounds and thoroughly enjoyed the intimate setting on the Bay. Coming from the sweltering MidWest, I was anticipating an outdoor setting to become rather uncomfortable as the sun set, but was delighted to experience a cool musical evening without mosquitos!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Rainy Getaway”
Reviews.Author: soccr62949
Reviews.Content: We chose Humphrey's after using tripadvisor for a quick romantic getaway. We, sadly, got stuck with bad weather and it rained 90% of the time we were there. The bright side is that the room was wonderful. The rooms are VERY Tiki-- You might feel that you are in Hawaii instead of San Diego. We thought the concierge was very helpful. They planned out our evening for us. The grounds at Humphrey's ( though we did not spend too much time on them because of the rain) are beautiful! We peeked into the ampitheater and it looked like a great place to have a concert! We had a very romantic time. It was quiet and peaceful and the grounds and the rooms at Humphrey's really "take you away"--if you will.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but a few cautions”
Reviews.Author: brendonla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here for 2 nights for our 1-year anniversary this past weekend. We were upgraded to a jr. suite for $199 + taxes -- I have an IATA # (if you're a travel agent you know what this is) so don't ask for this rate and expect to get it. We stayed in Building B on the ground floor; this building is next to the concert area, so be forewarned that in the summer you probably will hear the concert if you're in this building -- but they're over by 10:30 p.m. Since we drove down from L.A. in the evening and didn't check in until 11 p.m. or so after the concert let out, I had to explain to 2 parking lot attendants that I was a guest checking in and thus I was allowed park near the building our room was in (you're given a lot pass for your windshield upon checkin; I never had a problem finding a space near our room). My wife and I found the suite layout a bit strange: the bed is near the door in one half, a TV and bar area separates the bedroom from the living room that opens onto a porch area with view of the concert site. We would have preferred to have it the other way around with the bed away from the hallway door, but we got used to it by second night. We checked out the Humphrey's by the Bay lounge/bar and were pleasantly suprised that we didn't have to pay cover since we were staying at the hotel. The crowd verged on the older side, say 40+; my wife and I are late 20s/early 30s. We still had a good time. The management knows when to cut patrons off that are wasted (I have a short fuse when it comes to dealing with drunks bumping in to me). The dance floor was crowded and made for good people watching. We ate breakfast at the on-site restaraunt the next mornig: ~$50 for 2 including tip. Service was friendly, food prep was a little drawn out. But the view of the marina really made up for it. Very relaxing. Pool area is very nice and resort like; extra pool towels are provided; didn't try the bar, but it looked pretty good! Enjoyed this area a lot. Don't plan to get many laps in here unless you go early right when it opens -- there were quite a few families here in the afternoon. Humphrey's location is excellent for going out in downtown San Deigo if you drove yourself in or have a rental car: you can be in the gaslamp district or Balboa Park in 10 minutes. We really liked this convenience. There's a computer with hispeed internet access provided for free in the lobby. Nice for looking up directions or checking email. There's apparently wifi in the rooms, but I didn't try this out, so I don't know if it's free or not. Negatives: the staff doesn't check the common hallway doors at night to make sure they're shut. This is obviously a security concern because if these doors remain open, anyone off the street can walk into the building. Secondly, we were awoken by the LOUD ICE MACHINE going at 7 a.m. our first morning! Had the doors been shut, we wouldn't have probably heard it. I complained about this when I checked out. If you're a light sleeper, you may not like the proximity to the San Deigo Airport -- once in a while -- but not often -- you can hear a plane taking off across the water. I can't speak to the paper-thin walls comments, but I did hear water pipes going once in a while as well as our neighbors the second morning moving their bags out. Would I stay here again? If I can get the special rate again for the jr. suite, sure. But there are other lodging possibilities in San Diego -- this is just one.

Reviews.Title: “One of my most enjoyable weekend getaways”
Reviews.Author: UK_to_LA
Reviews.Content: We just spent a couple of nights in San Diego at Humphreys, and couldn't have been any happier. The check-in process was excellent. We were meeting up with friends arriving later that evening, and although they don't have connecting rooms in the hotel, they went out of their way to ensure we had rooms next to each other (even though the hotel was very busy). On top of that, we requested rooms overlooking the marina, and they sorted that out for us too! One thing you should be aware of - Humphreys host regular (outdoor) weekend concerts on the hotel grounds, so during the evenings it might not be deathly quiet (depending on your room location). As it turned out for us, we had a room with a PERFECT view of the concert stage. Although the performing acts weren't artists we would usually pay to watch, it was still great to be able to watch it from our balcony for free!!! The rooms themselves are very nice. Everything looked new. Beds were extremely comfortable. As for other hotel facilities....the pool and hot tub were excellent. The poolside bar was nice for evening drinks. The view from marina/bay facing rooms is superb. The putting green and crocquet lawn weren't used by us, but a nice touch nonetheless. We didn't eat at all in the hotel, with trips to downtown San Diego via taxi taking about 10 minutes, and costing between $15-$20. All-in-all, I would highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: servok
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time to stay at Humphreys in 20 years; twice in the last two years. We keep coming back because the place is so convenient and is staffed with enjoyable personnel. It is a five-ten minute drive to the airport and fifteen minutes to downtown. It is an oasis amongst the atmosphere of a bustling marina. The restaurants and nightclub on the premises are excellent as are the grounds which are flush with blooming plants and manicured lawns. There are a handful of excellent restaurants within a mile or so. Some you can walk to in under five minutes. If you like top-notch nightly entertainment, keep an eye on the concert venue. The list of star entertainers is nothing short of spectacular. Where else can you go to see beautiful San Diego bay just a hundred yards out of your front door? In short, we are already planning our return visit! It is expensive during peak season but the added advantages help to soften the blow to the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Humphrey's and would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: kimbykimby
Reviews.Content: If in San Diego again, I would definately consider Humphrey's again. The rooms are large and spacious, the decor in our room was not outdated and everything in the room was spotless. We had a second floor room overlooking the lovely grass area. Room had a double, glassed builtin-robe which was really great.. Very central to downtown and the airport and the area around the hotel is really nice. Only one little qualm, there are no lifts to second floors, so luggage has to be carried up stairs, but apart from that it was perfect. Staff were great and helpful and we really enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: baratometer2
Reviews.Content: We were plesantly surprised by our stay at Humphrey's 6/5. We booked on priceline for ~$100. I think you could probably get it cheaper on normal weekend, but there was a marathon in town and everything was booked. Anyway, for a 3 star property, the grounds were immaculate. Very lush, tropical landscaping. Rooms were newly renovated and nice. We were upgraded to a suite at no charge. The rooms are a good size. The hotel is older, so the outside is just okay, but the inside was very good. Our only complaint was there seemed to be a party going on above us and we could hear the music. Very convinent location to get to downtown area. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I think all the rooms have a balcony or patio. Fitness center is not good, so don't expect to really work out. There is a concert stage on-site and they have things going on in the summer. I would definitely recommend this place, especially if you can get it in the $70/night range.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The room, the pool and surrounding areas were great!! Check the concert schedule because it appears that they have concerts there every Friday evening from May - October. In addition, Shelter Island is central to just about everywhere in San Diego and only minutes from the airport. I will definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “It's not all that!”
Reviews.Author: sunflower2499
Reviews.Content: Let's just start off by saying that if I had to do it all over again. I wouldn't stay there. It started out promising, the location was beautiful and the grounds were nice. We had been there for brunch several times, but had never seen the rooms. We requested a view suite on the second floor but we were given a view suite on the first floor. Except for the bathroom, the room was horrid. It was dark, dingy and had a musty smell. No bright colors, all in hues of brown. The only bright spot was the bathroom it was beautiful. My husband left immediately and expressed our disappointment. He came he informed me that we had been 'upgraded' to the 1000 sq ft Grand Marina suite. This time we had the same beautiful bathroom but the same dark hues. Both suites had full sized beds in them. It was our anniversary, the beds we uncomfortable for one but worse for two. By the time we left, I felt like Lucy and Ricky in separate beds. Room service was poor, they messed up the order twice and we had to pay for the Sunday paper. I would think, if you were spending over 300 per night for a room, that it would be included. Our view of the marina was nice but I would not stay there again. I would rather have been at the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: tammytennis
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels in San Diego area I decided on Humphreys. When I arrived they had upgraded me to a suite. What a pleasant surprise. The resort was very tropical. Beautiful grounds. Nice, quiet property. The pool looked great even though I didn't use it. The hot tub was huge and constantly had someone in it. The front desk staff were not all that friendly but I didn't go for the staff. The only problem were the pillows were horrible. I slept without most of the time. Bring your own unless you like big cheap pillows. I would stay here again for sure. There really isn't much around as far as food, entertainment but everything was within 10 min. drive. I had thought about Hotel Circle. So glad I didn't. It is right off the freeway with tons of hotels/motels around. For the same price you could get a room at Humphreys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveGifford
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent 3 nights here in March. We got decent rates on Expedia - around $100 per night. We had a pool side room on the ground floor, which was lovely for stepping out amount the many tropical plants and trees. One of the best laid out hotels I have stayed in and very atmospheric. Shelter Island was quite relaxing and glad we stayed here away from downtown. It takes about an hour to get downtown on public transport from here. Its around 15 mins walk to bus stop, and then 25 min bus trip to Old Town transit centre and then 20 mins on Blue line trolley. This is pretty straight forward though and getting a transit pass helps. Hotel service was generally very good, in particular the concierge Amanda who gave us some excellent advice. The hotel has a nice pool and spa. It is quite close to the airport and they run a complimentary shuttle. Also, it has free internet access. No meals are included. Would definitely consider again if in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great tropical place to stay...reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Humphrey's could not have been better. Beautiful pool area, very friendly staff. Follow up phone calls to check on our requests. Our view of the bay was wonderful. My husband is a marine and aviation buff. To him the ability to watch water activity on the bay was great fun. As my husband said " If they put an upscale mattress in this place it would be a gem". We had a Jr Suite at 229/night. It was a great deal. We would glad to be away from the throng of downtown. I would stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic
Reviews.Content: Humphreys is a fantastic hotel of which I would recommend to anyone who is going on a relaxing vacation to San Diego. Tropical plants surround the resort and inner area of the hotel rooms which give you the feeling of being on vacation.. i love it! The outdoor pool area is wonderful with comfortable lounge chairs, beautiful plant life and of course under the almost always sunny skies of San Diego. It is located on Shelter Island in the Marina (if you like boats, you have a lot to view outside your room each morning with your coffee) It is a 10 minute drive from the Airport and close to all the major attractions. I would highly recommend a car no matter where you stay in San Diego. This is probably my favorite US city - There will be lots to do! As a bonus, the BMW concert stage is located on the property and if you are lucky you will get a view of whomever is performing. It costs extra to go into the concert and sit down, however, If you like the artist pay for a concert view room. A lot of fantastic stars have played here.. Macy Gray, Seal, Norah Jones.. and even old timers.. haha! Have a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay -- everything was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: rmjsah
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in San Diego and Anaheim. We spent six nights at Humphrey's (we enjoyed it so much that, after our initial five nights, we rearranged our visit to Anaheim to return to Humphrey's). We were impressed with Humphrey's and would strongly recommend it to others. The location is central to most attractions but is actually located on Shelter Island. It was a quick drive to attractions and anything else we needed. The rooms are spacious, well laid out and very clean. Our's had a nice view of the marina. The grounds are beautiful with extensive landscaping and walking paths. Our kids (6 & 8) were most impressed with the pool and activities (ping pong, small mini-golf area and croquet). The pool was very large and the shallow end alone was nearly as large as a typical hotel pool. We ate breakfast and dinner at the restaurant and were impressed with each (the views are exceptional). The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge planned an Easter egg hunt for the kids on Easter morning! We spent several afternoons during our trip lounging around the pool. I would strongly recommend this as a place to combine sight seeing and relaxation. We will definitely return to Humphrey's.

Reviews.Title: “Just one disappointment: the "free" broadband didn't work”
Reviews.Author: Kurt O
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Jr Suite for 6 nights. We had room 204, building A, on the second floor, facing south toward the bay. See the hotel map attached to this review. The view from the balcony was open and sunny. First floor rooms on the bay side have patios, looking out on the parking lot. The Deluxe Jr Suite has a queen bed in a nook as you enter, and a sleeper sofa, table, and TV 1. The sleeping areas are separated by the bath room and a short, doorless hall. A cleverly angled cabinet for TV 2 added a touch more privacy. There's a counter in the hall with a bar sink, microwave and a small fridge. The bath was impressively remodeled with marble all around. Overall, the setup worked fine for 2 adults and 1 teenage daughter- much better than a standard room. We paid $189. We were able to book on the hotel's website even though all other sites and the live reservation line showed no vacancy. The hotel advertises free Wi-Fi highspeed internet, but it never worked in our building even though the WAP signal was strong. It did work in the lobby and at poolside, which are on a different WAP. The hotel staff was sincere, but clueless. I called the provider, SuiteSpeed, 3X without success.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, nice motel but.......”
Reviews.Author: BCanadian
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Humphrey's from March 11-15 2005. We found a great rate of $139.00 Canadian a night compared to over $200.00 a night through our Travel Agent. The Motel has complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport and Amtrak Station every half hour. Check in was good, we ended up with a Marina View Room, no balcony but the window was quite large. Section M is a long way from the pool if you have children. The hotel is older but has been renovated and the rooms are quite nice and very clean. We only had a shower, no tub, fridge and a coffee maker as extras which was nice. The pool area is beautiful, very tropical and very clean. The gardens are very nice and the young lady at the concierge was wonderful, very friendly. The hotel is not close to attractions and we had to taxi it which can get expensive. Most of the restaurants are expensive in this area and not really kid friendly. I would stay here again but not with children, I felt it was more of an adult resort and not really geared for kids. The area is high end with the marina surrounding it so be prepared for higher prices. The walls dividing the rooms are also quite thin, one morning we could hear word for word the conversations of the people staying right next to us and they weren't loud. If you can get a good rate and either a marina or garden view you won't be dissapointed but if you are travelling with children I would choose a place more central to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at humphrey's for 6 nights in october 2004 when we were at conference in san diego. The room had everything you needed, was clean and quite big, although nothing extraordinary. The hotel facility, however, is lovely. Lovely pool area, with hot tub and bar. Lawn for playing crocket, palm trees, a pond with fish and fantastic wiews of the harbor. Since it is located on shelter island (which itself is a nice area) it's almost necessary to have a car to get in to town. You can take the buss, but that only goes every half hour, and then you have to change to the train to get down town. The restaurant is also very nice. Overall, a fantastic hotel, a bit far from the center.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of tropical serenity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for Valentine's Day weekend and we both enjoyed it very much. We live in southern Orange County, CA, so we were able to drive down there. Although it is off the beaten path it is still very close (5 minutes - tops) from the "hot spots" of San Diego. The outside of the establishment is a bit drab and looks almost a little run down. But the interior of the rooms, the grounds, and the lobby are all upscale and refined. Check-in was painless and easy. One thing you HAVE to do is ask for any upgrades. Otherwise your room will face the parking lot. We asked for an upgrade ($20 extra per day) and our room and patio faced the putting green. The room was very spacious! We got the standard room with a king size bed and there was plenty of room for the both of us. They have nightstands on both sides of the bed with 2 HUGE drawers that hold all your stuff. The armoire that holds the TV also had three large drawers. The closet is very big as well. Bottom line - you can put everything you brought away someplace so it is out of the way! The room also has a coffee maker and fridge as well. This is a nice touch for breakfast food, snacks, and drinks. The grounds are amazing! Although we explored San Diego during the day, many of the guests just hung by the pool all day. The grounds give a feel of being in Hawai'i with all the palm trees, tropical plants and colorful flowers. There is a bar outside, and employees walking around to provide service. There is also an area with a stage for concerts that happen in the summertime. We did not get to use the fitness center, but I peeked in and it seemed nicer than the average hotel fitness centers. Besides the pool, the other parts of the resort are very green with trees, grass, and walkways to take you around. We ate at the restaurant for Sunday brunch and the view of their private marina was beautiful! This place is definately worth it! We are planning another visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Sydney2121
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Humphrey to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary. The rooms were comfortable and spatious. The view of the bay and of downtown San Diego was spectacular. The hotel is close to everything and the onsite restaurant is amazing. The food was wonderful, the drinks were expertly made and the view was beautiful. The only negative we experienced during this trip was the surly desk person who insisted I had booked a room with two queens. He changed us to a king size room and the rest of the trip was a breeze. The lady at the front desk when we checke dout was all happiness and smiles. This hotel earns a A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, roomy, has modern interiors and amenities, and a friendly staff. All the fears I have when selecting a place to stay when travelling were put to rest after this stay. Stay here if you are a worrier!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Humphrey's for 3 nights with our 2 kids. We had a Jr. Suite and it was perfect. The kids loved the heated pool and lawn games. The room was a good size and had a sink and refrigerator. Perhaps not the flashiest hotel in San Diego but a great place to stay. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Only about 15 mins. from the zoo and from sea world. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a beautiful location and great place to soak up beautiful San Diego. Great food and service. The night life at the humphrey's lounge was very energetic with a fantastic live band that kept us dancing all night long. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego or just looking for a fun and romantic night out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: intothewoods
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego. Booked 4 nights at this hotel due to overall positve feedback . Got a nice rate from expedia ($159.00) for a view suite. When I checked in I was told that I had booked a standard room. I had a copy of the reservation showing that I had booked a view suite. I was told to wait a moment while the reservation was checked. The clerk returned and said, yes a garden suite was booked, but she upgraded it to a harbor view suite. The room was very nice. The view was beautiful. You can tell that this was an old hotel that has been updated. Our room (416) was very clean. It included a kitchen, sitting room 2 queen beds and a large bathroom. The bathroom had granite counters, 2 sinks, marble floor and marble tile in the shower area. The room also includes 2 sliding glass doors complete with screens. We only ate in the resturant for brakfast one morning. Once again a beautiful view and quality food at a resonable price. The location is also ideal. It's close to the airport and far enough away fron the downtown to be very peaceful, yet within 15 minutes of most anywhere you'd like to go in San Diego. You can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful base to discover s.diego”
Reviews.Author: Gezandy
Reviews.Content: A group of six of us (three couples) stayed at Humphrey's for three nights 6-8 Jan, 2005, as part of a tour of W.california and Vegas. We were all very pleased with the rooms, all of which looked over the car park and over the bay. Checking in staff were more than helpful and rooms were spotless and kept that way by the housekeeping staff. We had stayed in hotels in San Fran and N. York whose standards were a lot lower than this one and we found that the staff here were a lot more friendly. The pool/jacuzzi area looked lovely - not that we got the opportunity to use it - we experienced an awful rain/wind storm on our second day! Went to a live music nite in the bar/restaurant building and had a brilliant nite. Local people who go to these music nights were so friendly and welcoming. We did'nt see S.diego in the best season (weather-wise) but we are determined to revisit in warmer times and would definitely stay at Humphreys again. Don't know what other reviewers were on about when they say it could do with a refit - our rooms must have been done!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with Humphrey's. We booked on Hotels and got a rate of slightly over 100$ per night for a party of 3 adults and a child. The hotels in the so-called "hotel circle" were about the same price, but speaking location we are talking two different worlds. Humphrey's is located in a quiet, beautiful spot on Shelter Island, only a few minute's drive from the top attractions: SeaWorld, San Diego Zoo, Mission Bay, La Jolla, also Downtown and others. Upon checking in we asked for an upgrade to a garden view room and got it for an extra of only 10$ per night which is peanuts compared with the difference between a parking lot view room and the garden view room. The room was absolutely ok, bathroom clean. Housekeeping very efficient. All staff were very friendly and helpfull. Restaurant excellent, however breakfasts were a bit disappointing. Landscaping is doing a wonderful job and grounds are very beautiful. Parking is free which is an advantage in the city where some hotels charge easily 20$ per night to park the car. It is a motel-style hotel so do not expect big granduer but if you are looking for a quiet setting this is the place, also (and especially) if travelling with kids. Bottom line: wonderful hotel, but please make sure to choose a garden or marina view room rather than parking lot view room and before you book, do your research on various hotel-booking web sites to get the best rate. If again in San Diego, we'll definitely stay again at Humprey's.

Reviews.Title: “Location disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was very good, it is located quite a way from San Diego city centre. If visiting San Diego again, I would choose a hotel more central so I could walk to the shops and restaurants. I used the car alot during our stay. Room, pool and service were excellent - location disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LucyKate
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice hotel, in a good location with very nice gardens. But the rooms are a bit dated (although there was extensive renovation work underway when we were there) and a bit over priced for what you got. We also had problems at breakfast - the "free breakfast" came with a quite restrictive price limit, and they tried to charge us separately for the orange juice and tea and coffee that came with the contibental breakfast. We enjoyed our stay here, but, for the price, would probably look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “loved this holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a couple age 27 & 26 from England. We went to this hotel in July 2004 and would definitly consider going back again if we were ever in the area. Our room was nothing special, in fact it was very dark and we were in a ground floor room behind the generator for the hot tub. So we would insist on a better positioned room next time. We cant complain though because we got a really good deal and spent very little time in our room anyway. It was very clean and quiet once we were in there. The pool area is great and the only downside to this is that we planned on doing a lot more sightseeing on our trip, but enjoyed being by the pool so much that we only left the area 3 days out of 7. We went into the gaslamp district quite a few times in the evening and its really easy to get taxis there and back. We were watching a film called 'Bring it on' last weekend, and we were surprised to see that when they check in to what is supposed to be a hotel in Florida, its actually this hotel. Check it out if you want to see the pool area and gardens before you go. The one thing that made this hotel special was the food in the restaurant. It was reasonalbly priced and was so nice. I have been craving for the swordfish since I got back, and my partner said he had the best steak he'd ever had there.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay @ the Half Moon Inn was Half Good/Half Poor”
Reviews.Author: 1EZrider
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were high, seeing that Humphrey's was rated #5 in San Diego. We stayed 3 nights, and was a bit disappointed with the room, even though we upgraded to a Bay View room. The room was somewhat out-of-date, and had a musty odor. The view was nice, but the rooms could use some updating. The fire pull box handle at the bottom of the stairs was missing; a bit disconcerting. For the same money, next time I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in San Diego and Humphries Half Moon Inn”
Reviews.Author: wikki
Reviews.Content: Whow - a lovely place. We spent 4 nights of our holiday there and thought the hotel was lovely. We asked for an upgrade to a marina view suite and got a reduced rate. The suite was very spacious and had a kitchen area too if you wanted to be self catering. My only complaint was the noise of the pipes and water whenever we or our neighbours flushed the toilet. The resturant is one of the finest in San Diego and has fab views of the harbour. Specify a window seat if you book to eat there. There is a free hotel shuttle to and from the airport. There are not that many shops in the immediate vicinity but just down the road of Shelter Island you will find a few fish resturants, a Subway sandwich outlet, Pizza place and a Liquor/ Food Mart. To go to the main shopping area you will need a taxi/bus which will probably cost you in the region of $20 each way. The best way to see the sites is to go on the City Stop Trolley which costs around $25 each. You get to see the main parts of the city including Coronado,Old town & Seaport village and can get on and off whenever you like. Horton Plaza is great for shopping - especially Nordstom shopping centre!! There's also a great food pavillion on the top floor of the outdoor shopping area and a great Star of India food outlet. You can get info on these trips by visiting --------------------- Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. From the time we booked the room we were treated great. We found a cheaper rate online, called the hotel and they matched it. We reserved an Executive Suite and were upgraded to the Grand Marina Suite. This room was huge and great because we were four adults in one room. The first night the A/C was not working in the bedroom. They were still fixing it at 9pm. The repairman, sent to the bar for drinks and the hotel paid for them. I would tell anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's Hmmm?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our initial arrival at the hotel was wow this place is cool, we were checked in by a very friendly helpful Aussie girl (whose name I didn't get), the room itself was quite outdated but clean and a reasonable size. We were at ground level overlooking the carpark but could see the city right across the bay which is not a bad view at all. We had our own hire car which is essential if you stay at Humphreys as it is about 6-7 miles from downtown. The pool area was fine with a decent pool if you get hot and bothered, although we didn't spend a huge amount of time there because there were better things to do with our time. We had breakfast once in the hotel but preferred Red Sails down the street. There are concerts on the hotel grounds between May and October but unless you go to bed before 9pm these shouldn't cause a problem. The hotel was a bit pricey but this seems to be the case with all hotels in the San Diego area. Overall it wasn't quite as cool as we initially thought but it wasn't the worst hotel experience we've ever had, but we would probably try somewhere else in San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Humphrey's Half Moon Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the second week of a three week holiday[16th September- 23rd September] at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn & Suites, could not fault it in anyway. Food excellent, rooms very nice, staff very pleasant and helpful and had the added benefit of the concerts. We are saving to return asap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no worries if you book here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our 15 day tour of the Western US. The place was picked almost purely from the reviews on this website, and we weren't disappointed. Although we had no upgrade and a view of the car park, the Inn is excellent. A short walk across the island gives fantastic views of the San Diego skyline, my camera was busy. Didn't eat in the hotel, we went to the Red Sail Inn a short distance away for breakfast. It's cheaper and it too has lovely harbour views. The Bali Hai restaurant on the island is superb. We were given a window seat with a nightime view of San Diego, absolutely stunning, and it's not expensive either.

Reviews.Title: “Too pricy for what you get”
Reviews.Author: deannaj
Reviews.Content: After much research for hotels around San Diego, we decided to stay at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn & Suites after reading such great reviews. I must say my boyfriend and I were disappointed. We paid $220 for one nite in what we could only call an extremely average hotel. Definitely NOT worth the money. The room was small with outdated decor. Shelter Island itself is very boring, unless you own a yaht--which we do not! The pool was nice, but crowded on the weekend, and we tried to get in the spa later that nite, and found it packed with people. Definitely not the romantic getaway we had hoped for! We had also requested a non-smoking room, and even confirmed with the front desk once we arrived, who claimed all the rooms were non-smoking. But the minute we stepped into our room, it reeked of smoke. They did transfer us to another room no problem. I would not recommend this hotel and we will most likely not be back. Don't be fooled by the rave reviews on here...maybe the suites are much nicer, but the standard room is nothing to rave about. Don't waste your money and instead find a nicer hotel at probably half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Shoppadownunder1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphries for 3 nights last week and thought it was fantastic, great rooms as shown on the web and lovely pool and spa. We also used their bikes which were free for 2 hrs and were great fun. The only thing we had a problem with was one night there was a wedding reception at the concert area and they had closed off the laundrey however upon requesting access at reception this was arranged. Also we did think that anyone should check where their room is situated within the complex as some rooms looked over the concert area and carpark which is fine if you are out partying all night but otherwise request a garden view room which is what we did after reading other reviews on the site. Make sure you eat breakfast at the restaurant as the view is magic and the food delicious. We will definately be back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: Greenfielder
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here from 21st to 25th August. We were upgraded to an Executive suite with a marina view and this is a hotel where the room location is all-important. We can understand the more negative comments so the moral is, specify a marina view. If you have done that, you will not be disappointed. The front desk staff were brilliant, the service at breakfast was superb and the pool is the best of many we sampled on this holiday. The hot tub as exactly as described! The bar in the pool area is a nice touch and the television there allowed us to keep in touch with the Olympic games. We would definitely stay again if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort-hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CRK
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 6 nights at Humphreys and we LOVED it. Our room was on the first floor facing the gardens and it was beautiful! The pool was very nice with a great bar. The concerts did not bother us (but we were located on the opposite end of the hotel), when we closed the patio door we couldn't hear it at all. Our 2 and 5 year olds loved it and we will definitely stay here again. I highly recommend it to families with children. The staff was great and the location was perfect for day trips around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: Antony
Reviews.Content: FIRST OF ALL, THANK YOU TRIPADVISOR REVIEWERS, I BOOKED THIS PLACE BECAUSE OF YOU AND YOU DID NOT LET ME DOWN. My wife and 2 kids stayed here from 24-27 Aug and it was a perfect place to finish our 5 city US tour. Driving down from LA, I hoped San Diego and Humpreys was going to finish our hoilday on a good note, and it did. We stayed in an Executive Marina View Suite, 10/10, absolutely great ( not cheap, £180, $330 + tax ) but worth every penny. If your budget can afford it, stay in one of these rooms, its worth the extra, especially if you have kids. The room was as new every day as the cleaning services are really good. The hotel has a really good pool, and excellent hot tub. Even in peak season its not overcrowded. Humphreys has several negative reviews regarding the concerts. The concerts are very well managed and are all over and done by 10.30pm. Its kinda cool listening to the bands warm up around 4pm by the pool. I met REO Speedwagons drummer and his beautiful wife and children by the pool bar, got chattin, and met them back stage after the gig. This alone was a perfect ending to our holiday/vacation. I loved San Diego, and if i ever come back ( one day i hope ), i would not even think about staying anywhere else. Also, conceriege and all the staff made sure our stay was an enjoyable experience. Shelter Island is a perfect place to stay in San Diego, its away from the hustle and bustle, but close enough, should you be bothered to venture out!! If anyone has any queries, please feel free to e-mail me>

Reviews.Title: “Concerts attract noisy and thoughtless guests”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. What would have been a fantastic hotel was spoilt by the noisy concert-goers who shouted and laughed at the top of their voices till about 1 or 2 a.m. without a thought for anyone who might just be trying to sleep! As another reviewer remarked, the door left a gap between it and the frame and you never felt particularly safe in the downstairs rooms facing the car park. (Ask for a room at the back if you can get one.) The rooms themselves are spacious and the cabins make a change from an ordinary hotel room. The gardens, pool area and lobby are all very pleasant and the hotel has its own laundry, though it closes at 4..pm. on concert days!(Not much use to us!). Would probably not stay here again unless we can be assured of a quieter room facing the pool or harbour .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Judee512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphrey's during the first week of July 2004. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The pool area was lovely, very landscaped with almost too many trees. We did have a problem with ants in our room, but they came and sprayed the area very quickly. Just a little heads up. If you reserve a room with a "bay view", it's more like a parking lot view with the bay in the distance. I was a little disappointed with looking out at cars, although the evening view with the lights across the bay was very pretty. If you stay on the first floor facing the bay, you have no view at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lush, tropical grounds, sail boats, cool air and concerts every night!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Humphrey's Half Moon Inn. Upon arrival we were given the key to a dirty room that was not in a good location-it went rapidly better from there. We asked for a nicer room so we got a garden view room on the second floor overlooking the pool and palm trees. The grounds were so lush and tropical, the pool was clean, hot tub was hot and the pool bar was great! The staff was nice and the views of all the boats was awesome. I really like boats so this was a real treat. Shelter Island was great with a walking path and views of the San Diego Skyline. The hotel was a little older but well kept and the grounds are unsurpassed and our room had a vaulted ceiling and granite countertops in the bathroom. Concerts did happen every night but we really loved it, but we're young and enjoy that kind of stuff. Book it at sandiego as I paid $185 a night and noticed lots of other websites at $250 plus. I wouldn't have paid any more than $185-$200 for this hotel, though. It is also centrally located and close to Sea World (WAY OVERCROWDED), San Diego Zoo (GREAT-MUST SEE!), Coronado Island (great day trip) and much more!

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Vbg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Diego and were very disappointed by this hotel. It seems like being an inn keeper is an after-thought at this hotel. Priority is given to the "Concerts by the Bay" that go on several times a week (at least in the summer) inside the cramped outdoors quarters. This means, whether you like it or not, you'll hear the music blaring until 10:30pm (at least) and if you're in building A, you'll be harrassed by the ticket controllers. Now, when there is no concert, there are weddings, with outdoor music and noisy guests who wake you up at 2am and 4 am by loudly talking outside your door. If this place was cheap, it wouldn't bother me so much, but at $240 w/o tax a night for a junior suite we really felt ripped off. Needless to say we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Nitrobrune
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room on the first floor. Once in the room, we discovered that the door to the adjoining room was not locked, so we took care of that. The party in the adjoining room was very loud, even in the afternoon. We could hear everything said and done in that room until 2AM when the group there was finally evicted. We were out most of the day and discovered the party still going on in the late evening. I complained at 11PM. It didn't quiet down at all. We also had an ice machine right outside our door. Once the group was evicted, they started to hang out around the ice machine. Just as I was getting ready to pick up the phone once again, a guard ordered these "guests" off the property. It was quiet at last. The room's furnishings were ordinary with two beds, a table, chairs & TV. There was so much furniture in the room (or the room was so small) it was difficult to get to the bathroom because there was only about a foot between the bed and the bathroom area wall. We complained about the noise during checkout and were offered an upgrade on our next visit. I'm not sure we would stay there again on our own, but are scheduled for a convention next year. We took the upgrade and hope for a better experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a single room, king bed for me, my husband and our 11 month old. Upon seeing our room I realized that it was not the same room I saw online (not our fault) and not nearly enough room for the three of us (totally my fault). We asked for a Garden View Suite upgrade and negotiated the price down to a resonable cost. We went to lunch and came back around 3pm thinking our room would be ready. It wasn't and our baby was rapidly melting down in their lobby (not pretty). They proceeded to upgraded us yet again to a harbor view suite with a full kitchen. We had a FANTASTIC and relaxing time. Everything was awesome and we felt like royalty. The staff is very accomodating, friendly and helpful. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A break from the ordinary...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a break from the ordinary, run-of-the-mill chain hotel, this place is for you! Lush, tropical scenery surrounds this lodge and creates an atmosphere that is relaxing. The surrounding area provides you with several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. If you stay over a weekend, make sure to try the Sunday morning "jazz and champagne" brunch...well worth it! A great place for children, also. The pool and spa provide hours of entertainment. The staff was very pleasant and concerned about their customer's satisfaction. An enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pitypooh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I searched for many hours trying to find just the right place for a get-a-way. Every time we found a place on the web that sounded great we checked the Trip Advisor website. Each time we changed our mind based on the reviews, Keeping in mind that someone would have to have a truly bad experience to take the time to post a review. We found Humphrey's and mostly good reviews. We found them to be true. We had a jr. suite on the end of a building right next to the concert venue. We saw one concert free. If you don't want noise from that make sure you book on the other end or stay when no concerts are going on. The concert was fun and was over by 10:30 (noise regs.) and tear down and the emptying of people was over in less than an hour. Bedding and bath immaculate. Draperies had a spot here and there, no bigs. Maid sevice wonderful. All staff helpful and polite, we were treated well. We booked through San Diego Chamber of Commerce and got a better deal than anything we could find through Expedia,Hotels.com etc. Ask for a view of their harbor not the outside one all you see is a parking lot and road. Or an inside garden view, Beautiful gounds. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Be very clear on expectations, then be pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading your reviews and viewing great website for hotel, we selected this location for a week long pleasure stay base in late May. The jr suite allowed my husband, my mother, and me to be close but not fully together. The hotel is a well kept funky 40 year old Tiki style complex with a great location and a certain style. I requested a view of the bay thinking it would be like the website. What I got was a view of the active public road, the public parking lot and channel for San Diego Bay beyond! Oh, and huge fuel tanks for the Coronado navy base couldn't be missed. Not nice. Upon immediate complaint, I was very kindly told we could not move to more scenic quarters until the next day. However, the hotel garnered goodwill by keeping its promise and actually moving all our packed luggage and bags while we were enjoying ourselves elsewhere. CAUTION: Be specific about what scenic experience you are seeking. Leave the parking lot views to the block groups. It can really distinguish your visit as a good or less than good memory. The hotel staff was friendly, linens and bedding in good order, grounds truly lovely, and the resulting view across the concert grounds to the moorage was great! Also the bar menu was ample, good food and the bands were fun. (We were comp'ed as hotel guests for any cover charge.) We also just missed the Concert Nights which may affect parking, noise, etc. This location is convenient to Old Town via Rosecrantz, airport, freeways, downtown/Gas Light district, Balboa Park, and Point Loma. Parking was good and easy. Hotel provides advice on sights, other restaurants, and activities. Summary: If you want a romantic or beautiful setting, this could be for you. Avoid parking lot views--unless they almost give you the room. Eat the bar food for dinner and enjoy the sail boats moored out the windows. Work with the hotel to get the experience you are seeking. They can make you feel comforable and appreciated. You'll know you are not at a national chain staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great X'mas stay”
Reviews.Author: tiger62z
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Humphrey's Half Moon for three nights in December 2003. It has a great location, convenient to everywhere in the city. I love its restaurant with a wonderful view of the marina. They have live Jazz band almost every night and those band are usually pretty good. Listening to the wonderful Jazz music while enjoying the view of Christmas lights from all of those boats in the marina. What a treat! We were very satisfied with out stay. However, the carpet in our room was outdated, definitely needs to be changed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Toddlers”
Reviews.Author: GuelphOntario
Reviews.Content: We were visiting San Diego from Canada. I booked at Humphrey's based on all the good reviews on TripAdvisor. My wife, 2 year old daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in March 2004 and it was one of the most enjoyable stays we've ever had at a hotel. The location, restaurant and outdoor pool were all excellent. Access to the attractions in San Diego was very easy. I am normally very particular and critical of hotels, and we were on a pretty tight budget but our stay at Humphrey's was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, nice hotel .....but”
Reviews.Author: crimson999
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel should be great. The position on Shelter Island is truly wonderful with the large yacht harbour. The suite we had was marina-front and spacious. The "but" is that everything about the hotel was "not quite". The hotel charges luxury prices and everything we experienced was really good.....just not our definition of luxury for $300 a night. Nothing was particularly wrong and if you are paying $170 a night, you might consider the place fantastic. Nothing at all was wrong, it was just "not quite" Do please note that we had a really nice time in wonderful San Diego and the Red Sails restaurant along from the hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: traveling_mom_Boston
Reviews.Content: My mother, husband, 2 kids ages 3 and 6 and myself stayed for 4 nights. We had a lovely time. We got a great deal for an executive suite on the marina thru the San Diego CVB (convention visitor bureau). The rooms were clean and large. It was great having a stove top, microwave, refrigerator and toaster in the room. Room service even cleaned our dishes. We had 3 additional people over for pasta one night and the staff brought us additional plates, wine glasses, etc. It took a few tries to get the right people on line - they had to get the dishes from the restaurant. The hotel sponsored an Easter Egg hunt Easter morning and the kids loved it. Our room was very quiet. A few rooms overlook a parking lot which I would not like. On our last day my son spotted a sting ray and lobster in the water just outside our room. Also, a hummingbird was in the nearby bushes.

Reviews.Title: “great easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days 4 nights at Humphrey's. An excellent resort! Wife, two children (13 & 9) and myself had a great time. Our room was very clean and comfortable (a little dark). We had the basic room, downstairs with the back door opening to the putting green and pool. The pool is big and very well kept. You also have ping-pong and croquet. The grounds are truely magnicficant. The location is close to most everything. Seaworld 10-15 minutes, Zoo 20 minutes. HWY 8 and 5 nearby for access to the ocean and wildlife park. Downtown and airport 10 minutes. Went to the Padres game Saturday night by water taxi, only way to go! The resturant was very good. Sunday brunch was outstanding. Service and staff were very helpful and friendly. I highly recommend Humphrey's and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation through Hotels.com. When we arrived at the hotel, we were given a complimentary upgrade to a suite overlooking the bay. The room was clean and quiet. The beds were very comfortable. The view was spectacular. The staff were very pleasant to us. I would highly recommend this hotel and would return again and again.

HotelInfo.Name: Humphreys Half Moon Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2303 Shelter Island Drive, San Diego, CA 92106
